Title: Mid-level Data Scientist – Applied AI (B2C)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Trustpilot, we're on an incredible journey. We're a profitable, high-growth FTSE-250 company with a big vision: to become the universal symbol of trust. We run the world's largest independent consumer review platform, and while we've come a long way, there's still so much exciting work to do. Come join us at the heart of trust!

From millions of reviews to rich user interaction data, we have a vast amount of behavioral and content data that powers our consumer platform. In the B2C Applied AI team, we’re focused on leveraging AI and ML to improve how people discover, interact with, and trust businesses on Trustpilot.

We are seeking a Data Scientist to join our B2C Applied AI team to build intelligent, data-driven product features that improve user experience and deliver business impact. You will collaborate closely with a cross-functional team of engineers, product managers, designers, data analysts, and ML engineers to develop and maintain impactful AI/ML models at scale.

To succeed in this role, you’ll bring hands-on experience developing and deploying machine learning solutions, especially in areas such as ranking, search, recommendations, and personalization. You’ll also demonstrate a strong understanding of user behavior data and how to use it to influence product development. A product mindset and ability to work cross-functionally are essential.

What You’ll Be Doing


Great opportunity to make a real product impact by applying the state of the art in AI and ML.
Work on some of our most exciting Data Science initiatives aimed at improving the Trustpilot consumer experience: from ranking and recommendations to natural language processing and search.
Build, deploy, and maintain production-ready ML models that directly power features used by millions of users.
Collaborate closely with engineers, product managers, and designers to develop user-facing features informed by ML and experimentation.
Use data and model insights to identify new opportunities for personalization and discovery across our platform.
Take ownership of specific ML features or components and drive them from concept to production and iteration.
Work with leading tools such as GCP Vertex AI, BigQuery, Airflow, and emerging ML technologies.
Be a part of a friendly, diverse, innovative, international team and workplace that encourages learning and growth.


Who You Are


Experience working in a Data Science or Machine Learning role, ideally on consumer-facing products like search, ranking, recommendations, personalization, or discovery.
Strong hands-on ability with ML modeling, including semantic search, ranking algorithms, clustering, recommendation systems, and natural language processing (NLP), with a track record of deploying models to production.
Strong skills in data analysis, statistical modeling, and computational problem-solving; ideally with a background in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, or Computer Science.
Comfortable working with large-scale data and behavioral/user interaction data, and using it to build impactful, data-driven product features.
Proficient in Python and SQL, and confident working across the full ML lifecycle from exploration to deployment.
Experience with cloud platforms like GCP (preferred), AWS, or Azure, and tools such as BigQuery, Vertex AI, and Airflow.
Familiarity with ML production tooling and infrastructure, including CI/CD workflows.
Comfortable using metrics to monitor, iterate, and improve model performance.
Excellent communication skills — able to engage clearly and effectively with both technical teams and business stakeholders.
Collaborative and agile— experienced in working closely with Product Managers, UX Designers, and Engineers within cross-functional teams to create impactful solutions.
You take ownership, move quickly, and are driven to solve real user problems with scalable, measurable, and maintainable solutions.


What's in it for you?


A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
Competitive compensation package + bonus
25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)
Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
Rich learning and development opportunities are supported through the Trustpilot Academy and Blinkist
Comprehensive health package, pension, and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
Paid parental leave
Central office with a laid-back vibe and constant buzz of different languages being spoken everywhere you go It’s complete with a coffee bar, canteen, and table tennis and has a wide variety of refreshments available - you can opt-in for breakfast and lunch at an affordable price
Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities, and team socials
Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go-karting, cooking classes, and escape rooms
Employee discounts to restaurants and shops


Still not sure?

We are Open to All, which means we want everyone to feel like they can see themselves at Trustpilot. We're keen to hear about your experiences as well as how you can help to create a fantastic culture for our amazing Trusties. So, don't worry if you're looking at this job description and feel like you don't meet all the requirements, we'd still really like to hear from you!

About Us

Trustpilot began in 2007 with a simple yet powerful idea that is more relevant today than ever — to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. Trustpilot is open, independent, and impartial — we help consumers make the right choices and businesses to build trust, grow and improve.

Today, we have more than 300 million reviews and 64 million monthly active users on average across the globe, with 140 billion annual Trustbox impressions, and the numbers keep growing. We have more than 1,000 employees and we’re headquartered in Copenhagen, with operations in Amsterdam, Denver, Edinburgh, Hamburg, London, Melbourne, Milan and New York.

We’re driven by connection. It’s at the heart of what we do. Our culture keeps things fresh –– it’s built on the relationships we create. We talk, we laugh, we collaborate and we respect each other. We work across borders and cultures to be the universal symbol of trust in an ever-changing world. With vibrant office locations worldwide and over 50 nationalities, we’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace with diverse perspectives and ideas.

Our purpose to help people and businesses help each other is a tall order, but we keep it real. We’re a great bunch of humans, doing awesome stuff, without fuss or pretense. A successful Trustpilot future is driven by you –– we give you the autonomy to shape a career you can be proud of. If you’re ready to grow, let’s go.

Join us at the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is committed to creating an inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive and where different viewpoints and experiences are valued and respected. Trustpilot will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, religious beliefs, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, neurodiversity, disability, age, parental or veteran status. Together, we are the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is a global company and our data practices are designed to ensure that your personally identifiable information is appropriately protected. Please note that your personal information will be transferred, accessed, and stored globally as necessary for the uses and disclosures stated in our Privacy Policy.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Are you our new Data Scientist?

AudienceProject is looking for a Data Scientist for our Copenhagen office to support our continued growth.

—

Are you an analyst at heart? And do you have an interest in data modelling and programming? Then we have an opportunity for a career in a fast-growing scale-up that directly cooperates with companies such as Meta, Google, Amazon, Netflix, Disney+ etc.

AudienceProject is a leading SaaS company with 100+ employees delivering audience measurement and research solutions to major advertisers, agencies, and publishers across Europe.




Our platform enables clients to better understand the reach of their campaigns across channels, helping them make confident marketing decisions to reach their audiences more effectively.




Embarking on our second decade of audience measurement, we are now looking for a motivated Data Scientist to join our Data Science Research team.




Joining AudienceProject will give you a front-row seat in the rapidly evolving marketing technology sector and an opportunity to work within a respected business, delivering insights about audiences across the world's largest media channels to top-tier clients and some of the world’s biggest brands.




What you will do

You will be tasked with developing and implementing new methodologies related to both our platform as well as work on bespoke solutions for top-tier clients.




In the Data Science Research team, you will work with nine other team members and have close collaboration with the developers in our Product department. The team is small and dynamic, and there is plenty of room for innovation and good ideas are quickly turned into action.

You will use Databricks notebooks hosted on our cloud servers to interact with S3 for exploratory data analysis, visualizations and modeling. This is done in PySpark (or SparkR) since the vast amounts of data truly require distributed computing.




This role is heavily focused on programming and model development, with approximately 80% programming and 20% math/statistics. While we use standard libraries for utilities, we rarely rely on high-level, pre-built model functions. Instead, our team develops models from first principles, focusing on algorithmic design and mathematical/statistical foundations.

While we appreciate diverse backgrounds, this position is not aligned with business analytics, qualitative research, or linguistics-focused skill sets.




Essential qualifications

You have a Master's degree or higher education in a numerically oriented education (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, etc.). Candidates with a social science background, but specializing in statistics and data analysis, are also welcome to apply.
You have experience with data wrangling and analysis of large datasets and have developed a good intuition for how data can be used to create valuable insights.
You have a solid understanding of classical statistics techniques, for example descriptive statistics, time series analysis, and regression analyses.
You have programming/scripting skills. Our current toolbox includes Python and R. It is an advantage to have good knowledge of at least one of these languages, as the position is primarily programming-oriented.
You are curious, structured, and goal-oriented. You enjoy diving into complex issues but understand that the goal is to find workable solutions.
You can communicate your results in a non-technical manner and understand how to make complex data analysis useful for non-data scientists.

Further qualifications

Experience working with simulations, Bayesian statistics, and classical machine learning models, with a focus on understanding the underlying principles.
Experience with "human-centered" analysis and experience with analysing attitudinal data, such as survey and/or online behavioural data.
An ability to understand the business implications of data and analysis and how to use it to build a strategic story that engages and creates value for customers.
Coding hobby projects. We are interested in seeing what kind of programming related hobbies you have, or what kind of coding projects you have done in your spare time. This can be shared through a link in your CV/Cover letter.

Relevant working experience is viewed as a plus but is not a strict requirement.




What we offer

A unique career opportunity in a fast-growing scale-up full of curious, intelligent and creative people where you can grow as we grow our company.

Competitive salary
Pension scheme and health insurance
Home internet paid
Central Copenhagen office
Hybrid work model
Daily breakfast
Lunch made by an on-site chef
Unlimited snacks, drinks and coffee
Friday bars and quarterly company dinners
International environment
Friendly, supportive and helpful colleagues
Innovative and market-leading products and services
Exposure to a lot of data handling
Technically/commercially challenging tasks
Working directly with some of the most modern and successful companies of our time
Mentorship from thought leaders in the industry




Send us your application

If you can see yourself in the above and want to work for a leading SaaS company, we want to hear from you.




Apply via Linkedin attaching the following into ONE DOCUMENT:

CV
Cover letter
Copy of graduation certificates for both educations, with grade transcripts
Remember to include a reference/link to your coding hobby project in your CV or cover letter, if relevant




Attention: applications and documents sent via email will not be considered.

We are only considering candidates who are already based in Copenhagen, as we are unable to offer relocation support for this position.

You can only apply once to this position through Linkedin, so make sure to have all your documents condensed into ONE document.




The deadline for applications is August 17th, 2025. We will be inviting applicants for interviews on an ongoing basis.

We look forward to receiving your application!

Show more

Joining AudienceProject will give you a front-row seat in the rapidly evolving marketing technology sector and an opportunity to work within a respected business, delivering insights about audiences across the world's largest media channels to top-tier clients and some of the world’s biggest brands.


What you will do

You will be tasked with developing and implementing new methodologies related to both our platform as well as work on bespoke solutions for top-tier clients.


In the Data Science Research team, you will work with nine other team members and have close collaboration with the developers in our Product department. The team is small and dynamic, and there is plenty of room for innovation and good ideas are quickly turned into action.

You will use Databricks notebooks hosted on our cloud servers to interact with S3 for exploratory data analysis, visualizations and modeling. This is done in PySpark (or SparkR) since the vast amounts of data truly require distributed computing.


This role is heavily focused on programming and model development, with approximately 80% programming and 20% math/statistics. While we use standard libraries for utilities, we rarely rely on high-level, pre-built model functions. Instead, our team develops models from first principles, focusing on algorithmic design and mathematical/statistical foundations.

While we appreciate diverse backgrounds, this position is not aligned with business analytics, qualitative research, or linguistics-focused skill sets.


Essential qualifications

  • You have a Master's degree or higher education in a numerically oriented education (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, etc.). Candidates with a social science background, but specializing in statistics and data analysis, are also welcome to apply.
  • You have experience with data wrangling and analysis of large datasets and have developed a good intuition for how data can be used to create valuable insights.
  • You have a solid understanding of classical statistics techniques, for example descriptive statistics, time series analysis, and regression analyses.
  • You have programming/scripting skills. Our current toolbox includes Python and R. It is an advantage to have good knowledge of at least one of these languages, as the position is primarily programming-oriented.
  • You are curious, structured, and goal-oriented. You enjoy diving into complex issues but understand that the goal is to find workable solutions.
  • You can communicate your results in a non-technical manner and understand how to make complex data analysis useful for non-data scientists.

Further qualifications

  • Experience working with simulations, Bayesian statistics, and classical machine learning models, with a focus on understanding the underlying principles.
  • Experience with "human-centered" analysis and experience with analysing attitudinal data, such as survey and/or online behavioural data.
  • An ability to understand the business implications of data and analysis and how to use it to build a strategic story that engages and creates value for customers.
  • Coding hobby projects. We are interested in seeing what kind of programming related hobbies you have, or what kind of coding projects you have done in your spare time. This can be shared through a link in your CV/Cover letter.

Relevant working experience is viewed as a plus but is not a strict requirement.


What we offer

A unique career opportunity in a fast-growing scale-up full of curious, intelligent and creative people where you can grow as we grow our company.

  • Competitive salary
  • Pension scheme and health insurance
  • Home internet paid
  • Central Copenhagen office
  • Hybrid work model
  • Daily breakfast
  • Lunch made by an on-site chef
  • Unlimited snacks, drinks and coffee
  • Friday bars and quarterly company dinners
  • International environment
  • Friendly, supportive and helpful colleagues
  • Innovative and market-leading products and services
  • Exposure to a lot of data handling
  • Technically/commercially challenging tasks
  • Working directly with some of the most modern and successful companies of our time
  • Mentorship from thought leaders in the industry


Send us your application

If you can see yourself in the above and want to work for a leading SaaS company, we want to hear from you.


Apply via Linkedin attaching the following into ONE DOCUMENT:

  • CV
  • Cover letter
  • Copy of graduation certificates for both educations, with grade transcripts
  • Remember to include a reference/link to your coding hobby project in your CV or cover letter, if relevant


Attention: applications and documents sent via email will not be considered.

We are only considering candidates who are already based in Copenhagen, as we are unable to offer relocation support for this position.

You can only apply once to this position through Linkedin, so make sure to have all your documents condensed into ONE document.


The deadline for applications is August 17th, 2025. We will be inviting applicants for interviews on an ongoing basis.

We look forward to receiving your application!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Veo is a global leader in AI-based sports camera technology. Our innovative, fully automatic camera solution enables sports teams to record matches and training sessions without a camera operator. We’re democratizing the world of sports by granting video analysis for teams on all levels—a privilege that used to be only for the few. More than 40,000 clubs in 90+ countries record their games every week.

Growing as fast as we do in Veo means that every day is different, exciting, and challenging, both on the front line and in the back office.

But that’s not the most remarkable thing about us.

The coolest thing is our people. We’ve attracted some of the brightest minds in the industry. They are the reason we can create a great product and do it while enjoying ourselves.

As a Machine Learning Engineer at Veo you will get to work on challenging problems and directly contribute to the value created by our AI-driven end-user products.

You will become part of our AI team, which comprises 15 researchers and engineers responsible for all stages in the machine learning lifecycles across different projects - from scoping and defining data annotation tasks to modeling, validation, and deployment. You will be free to determine the directions of the project you work on while also getting feedback and being encouraged to spar with the rest of the team to assist each other in improving and succeeding.

We stay current with the latest research and continuously discuss concepts and ideas in recent papers to assess their relevance to our tasks and product-specific challenges.

We are looking to add yet another ambitious, high-performing junior to senior engineer/researcher with proven experience from real-world machine learning projects to the team. Experience with computer vision is advantageous but not a must.

What you will do:



Train state-of-the-art machine learning models
Write efficient inference pipelines for cloud and edge
Define and supervise data annotation tasks
Improve evaluation schemes to increase understanding of model performance and shortcomings
Contribute to long-term planning and prioritization of tasks




What you will need:



MSc or PhD in a relevant field
Hands-on experience with real-world, large-scale machine-learning projects
Great coding skills
Skilled at both autonomous tasks and contributing to group efforts
Ability to examine details closely and critically




At Veo, you'll be part of a thriving work environment where every day brings new excitement. Our rapid growth ensures a diverse and ever-changing atmosphere. We believe in work-life balance and providing a positive culture that allows you to thrive personally and professionally.

Our Copenhagen office mirrors our innovative technology – with an indoor ball court, rooftop terrace, and well-equipped gym. We have created a facility that supports connecting disciplines across the business, facilitates creative thinking, and gives the space to engage with colleagues, our global partners, and the entire Veo community.

Diversity and differences are valuable assets for us. We value diversity and inclusion and welcome people from all backgrounds. If you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we still encourage you to apply.

Values We Hold at Veo:

Dare - We take initiative, stay curious, and challenge the status quo in our work.

Own it - We drive impact by identifying opportunities, taking responsibility, and confidently executing.

Level up - We embrace growth, continuously learning and shaping our skills.

Play as a team - We collaborate across a diverse organization, leveraging shared insights for stronger outcomes.

Customer Centric - We deliver value by having close partnerships and a deep understanding of our customers (internally and externally)

We’re committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. And you may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.
Show more

Title: Graduate Data Scientist
Place: Vester Hassing, North Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
The Company

Veovo is a market leader in Airport Smart Technology. With a global footprint of customers and capabilities that cover Airport Operations, Revenue management and Passenger Flow. Some of the world’s largest airports rely on Veovo.  Focused on driving airport performance, our solutions enable airports to handle more aircraft and more passengers, with less delays and less queues. Our platforms are built on a modern tech stack, often delivered from the cloud as SaaS and leveraging intelligence to enable our customer to “go brilliantly”.

Our clients span continents, but all share one thing in common~ they’re big names in airport excellence, with even bigger digital goals. With offices in the UK, Poland, Denmark, New Zealand and the US, Veovo offers a world of opportunity

At Veovo we strive to deliver predictable collaborative solutions that are the platform of great airports. At Veovo we strive to deliver predictable collaborative solutions that are the platform of great airports.

The Opportunity

We focus on solutions in the analysis of queue and movement patterns as well as capacity forecasts. Our product, is cloud-based system that collects and analyzes data via proprietary (Bluetooth / WiFi) sensors, as well as third-party data sources such as camera, radar, infrared counters, coils, boarding cards, calendars, etc.

The solution primarily helps airports to forecast passenger appearance, optimize staff resources, reduce queue and travel times, and improve the experience for the passengers. In addition, we also create solutions for road traffic, railway stations, ports, ski resorts and amusement parks, with similar work and end-results.

Are you ready to be part of the team that brings our brilliant solutions "live" around the world?

The size of our installations are growing rapidly, and we are therefore seeking a skilled analytical person, who can help implement our solutions to help airports predict passenger arrival and flow. The implementation covers requirements, design, and calibration of the system. The calibration is carried out in-house via the setup of our filtering engine.

The Specifics


Identify valuable data sources and automate collection processes
Undertake preprocessing of structured and unstructured data
Analyze large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns
Build predictive models and machine-learning algorithms
Combine models through ensemble modeling
Present information using data visualization techniques
Propose solutions and strategies to business challenges
Collaborate with engineering and product development teams


What we are looking for


Knowledge of R, SQL and Python; familiarity with Scala, Java or C++ is an asset
BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field
Analytical mind and business acumen
Experience in data mining
Problem-solving aptitude
Excellent communication and presentation skills


What we offer in return


A job in a growing industry.
Employment immediately or by agreement.
An exciting position in a company with good working conditions with an open, direct and informal tone
A company where ideas are accelerated into action, and everyone can play a part in the development.
Excellent opportunities for personal and professional development through independent work assignments.
Workplace~ Hækken 2, Vester Hassing, 9310 Vodskov
37 hours working week


Show more

Title: Machine Learning Researcher
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Location: Copenhagen, Denmark

Job Type: Permanent

Industry: Financial Services / Capital Markets

Work Mode: Hybrid (On-site 4 days/week)




About the Client:

We have partnered with a Danish company specialising in Algorithmic Trading. The company has been the market leader in automating financial markets since 2008, shaping a fully automatic natural language processing system for reading and interpreting financial news.




About the role:

As part of this role, you’ll help design, optimize, and implement calibration and benchmarking frameworks, establish best practices for data processing pipelines, and prototype innovative predictive time-series models. With short feedback cycles, direct deployment, and minimal bureaucracy, your work will have immediate impact.




Team Environment:

You'll join a collaborative, intellectually curious team that values technical input and personal initiative. The group is composed of highly qualified researchers with deep experience in statistics, modelling, and machine learning, working closely with software engineering and trading teams. Knowledge-sharing is integral, and all members contribute code, ensuring mutual understanding across specialties.




Candidate Profile:

PhD or MSc in a quantitative discipline (engineering, physics, computer science, mathematics, or related fields)
3+ years of experience
Strong foundation in mathematics and statistics
Experience with the full machine learning development cycle—from data processing to deployment and monitoring
Proficiency in Python, especially for data processing and numerical analysis
Solid grasp of computer science principles
Analytical, scientific mindset
Right to work in Denmark(We can't offer sponsorship)




Bonus skills:

Experience handling large, complex datasets
Familiarity with frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, XGBoost, or CatBoost
Additional programming experience in languages like C# or C/C++




What’s offered:

Flat organizational structure fostering trust and autonomy
Challenging, interesting problems to solve
Supportive and highly skilled team
Modern workspace with a hybrid work model
Comprehensive benefits including pension, health insurance, and generous leave

Title: Data Scientist, Corporate Health, Safety & Environment
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you enthusiastic about data and have a desire to contribute to positive change? We’re seeking a Data scientist to join our team to contribute to Lundbeck’s ESG reporting and deliver meaningful insights through data-driven assessments.

For over a decade, we have reported on our sustainability efforts, the most important challenges and the impact on our business, stakeholders and the societies in which we operate. In the coming years we see an increase in expectations on transparency, consolidation into formal frameworks and requirements for corporate sustainability reporting and insights. Based on this, we have a new job opening in our Corporate Health, Safety & Environment team.

Your new role

As a Data Scientist in our Corporate Health, Safety, and Environment department, you will play a key role in collecting, managing, transforming, and visualizing ESG-related data to support our sustainability initiatives and reporting requirements. You will work with data related to climate change, waste, the circular economy, water, health and safety, and more. Collaborating closely with cross-functional teams, you will help ensure that accurate, meaningful data is available to drive informed decision-making and fulfill reporting obligations.

Key Responsibilities:

Data Collection:


Gather ESG data from various internal and external sources.
Ensure data accuracy, completeness, and consistency.
Develop and implement data collection methodologies and tools.



Data Storage and Management:


Design and maintain databases and data storage solutions for ESG data.
Implement data governance and internal control
Ensure efficient and scalable data storage systems.



Data Transformation:


Clean, preprocess, and transform raw data into usable formats.
Develop algorithms and models to analyze ESG data.
Identify trends, patterns, and insights from data.



Data Visualization:


Create visualizations and dashboards to communicate ESG data effectively.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand data visualization needs.
Prepare and present data insights to domain experts, decision makers and other stakeholders.



What You Bring To The Team

Whether your greatest strength is in solving technical challenges or igniting enthusiasm in delivering quality products, your colleagues would agree that you are a role model in collaboration and co-creation, and that you are technically adept. You are passionate about leveraging technology to deliver best-in-class data models.

In addition, you have:


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Environmental Science, or a related field.
Proven experience in data collection, management, transformation, and visualization.
Experience with dimensional modelling
Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages (e.g., Python, SQL).
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI or SAC).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.



Our promise to you

Lundbeck offers an inspiring workplace and innovative culture, where our curiosity, accountability and adaptability enable us to transform lives. We want to go faster and further on addressing the big unmet needs of people living with brain disorders. We offer rewarding careers with a mix of exciting tasks and development opportunities that are balanced with initiatives focused on your well-being.

We need every brain in the game, and at Lundbeck, we are committed to building a workforce that is as diverse as the people we serve. Read more about our commitment at www.lundbeck.com/global/about-us/our-commitment/diversity-and-inclusion.

Apply now

Can you see yourself in this role? We want to hear from you. Does this sound like your dream job, but you’re not sure if you meet all the requirements? We still want to hear from you!

Upload your CV and include your motivation for applying. No separate cover letter is needed. We ask you not to include a photo or personal information that does not relate to your professional experience.

If you have questions or want to hear more, please feel free to contact Danny Alves Ferreira, ESG Analyst at DAVF@Lundbeck.com

Applications must be received by 31 of August 2025.

Learn more about us at www.lundbeck.com, LinkedIn or Instagram (@h_lundbeck).

#EveryBrainInTheGame

This job ad is intended for individuals seeking a career opportunity with Lundbeck. We engage with recruitment and search firms where needed on the basis of a written agreement, and we do not accept unsolicited requests of any kind. If you work as a recruitment consultant, you are kindly instructed to refrain from contacting Lundbeck or the hiring manager directly with suggested candidates. If you violate this policy, you do so at your own risk and for your own account, and Lundbeck will not assume any liability nor pay any associated fees resulting from such violation.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data scientist with a passion for language, logic, and large language models

To support our continued growth and innovation, we are seeking a Data scientist to join our team in Aarhus. This is a unique opportunity to combine your love of language, structure, and data models, to help shape how we use LLMs, and other machine learning technologies in customer-facing solutions.

Who We Are

Founded in a garage in 2016 and now headquartered in the heart of Aarhus, Adversus is a fast-growing SaaS company with a talented team of +50 colleagues. We’ve established ourselves as a leading provider of cloud-based call center software, serving customers in more than 35 countries across the globe. We build smart, scalable solutions—and we always seek new ways to work smarter, not harder.

What You Will Be Doing

As our Data Scientist, you will help design, test, evaluate and refine the technologies that drive accurate, useful, and creative outputs from machine learning models. You’ll collaborate closely with developers, product managers, and customer-facing teams to ensure our AI features are reliable, effective, and aligned with real-world needs.

You will play a critical role in unlocking the full potential of AI across our platform, helping our customers with automated workflows, content creation, quality assurance, and improving their interactions with our platform.

How We See You


A structured thinker with a flair for language and logic
Familiar with tools like OpenAI’s GPT-4, and prompt engineering best practices
Able to package AI interactions in a format suitable for API consumption.
A pragmatic engineer with a solid understanding of technology limits, but also keeping an eye on the opportunities
Comfortable working in a collaborative, fast-paced environment
You’re fluent in English, both written and verbal.


Key Responsibilities


Craft, and iterate on effective inputs to power AI-driven features
Collaborate with development teams to integrate AI outputs into product workflows
Evaluate model behavior, identify edge cases, and propose improvements
Maintain libraries and documentation for internal use
Explore fine-tuning, embeddings, and retrieval techniques to improve performance
Stay up-to-date with AI advancements and bring fresh ideas to the team


If you’re a language lover, systems thinker, and AI enthusiast ready to turn creativity into capability, we’d love to hear from you!
Show more

Founded in a garage in 2016 and now headquartered in the heart of Aarhus, Adversus is a fast-growing SaaS company with a talented team of +50 colleagues. We’ve established ourselves as a leading provider of cloud-based call center software, serving customers in more than 35 countries across the globe. We build smart, scalable solutions—and we always seek new ways to work smarter, not harder.

What You Will Be Doing

As our Data Scientist, you will help design, test, evaluate and refine the technologies that drive accurate, useful, and creative outputs from machine learning models. You’ll collaborate closely with developers, product managers, and customer-facing teams to ensure our AI features are reliable, effective, and aligned with real-world needs.

You will play a critical role in unlocking the full potential of AI across our platform, helping our customers with automated workflows, content creation, quality assurance, and improving their interactions with our platform.

How We See You

  • A structured thinker with a flair for language and logic
  • Familiar with tools like OpenAI’s GPT-4, and prompt engineering best practices
  • Able to package AI interactions in a format suitable for API consumption.
  • A pragmatic engineer with a solid understanding of technology limits, but also keeping an eye on the opportunities
  • Comfortable working in a collaborative, fast-paced environment
  • You’re fluent in English, both written and verbal.

Key Responsibilities

  • Craft, and iterate on effective inputs to power AI-driven features
  • Collaborate with development teams to integrate AI outputs into product workflows
  • Evaluate model behavior, identify edge cases, and propose improvements
  • Maintain libraries and documentation for internal use
  • Explore fine-tuning, embeddings, and retrieval techniques to improve performance
  • Stay up-to-date with AI advancements and bring fresh ideas to the team

If you’re a language lover, systems thinker, and AI enthusiast ready to turn creativity into capability, we’d love to hear from you!

Title: Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Drive meaningful change

At our Data & Analytics department, we specialize in data visualizations, BI tools, analytical consulting, statistics, forecasting, and modern data platforms. Working closely with various departments across Abacus, we combine our analytical expertise with a deep understanding of pharmaceutical markets—from product development to delivery.

We believe that robust Data Science and AI can give Abacus Medicine a competitive edge, uncovering trends and behaviors that drive smarter decision-making. Our advanced machine learning techniques transform complex market data into actionable forecasts. Join us on our growth journey and help shape the future of the pharmaceutical industry.

Get a glimpse of our world

The Data Science team consists of five highly skilled professionals, all dedicated to improve global healthcare through better access to medicine by delivering critical data and insights that drive informed decision-making.

In this role, you will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams—including data analysts, data engineers, product managers, and key business stakeholders—to develop data-driven solutions that scale.

Are you ready to embark on this journey with us?

As a Data Scientist, you will play a key role in developing and deploying machine learning models that power business insights and operational efficiencies and support tactical and strategic decision-making across Abacus Medicine.

Your Responsibilities Will Include


Design, develop, and deploy advanced models, including machine learning, deep learning, and algorithmic solutions, to solve complex business problems.
Analyze datasets to generate actionable insights, ensuring data-driven decision-making.
Design and maintain scalable MLOps pipelines for seamless model deployment, monitoring, and lifecycle management.
Promote best practices in Data Science by optimizing workflows and expanding the DS/ML toolbox with tools that enhance model accuracy, runtime, and maintainability.
Strengthen our technical infrastructure by integrating modern technologies that enhance efficiency, scalability, and long-term maintainability.
Drive innovation by evaluating and integrating emerging ML/AI methodologies, including LLMs, to enhance model performance.
Translate complex model results into actionable insights for both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Share expertise through knowledge sharing and sparring sessions.
Proactively identify potential data science applications for value creation.
Contribute to branch development initiatives and long-term planning, including roadmap definition.


Fuel for your success in the role

We Imagine You Have


Master’s degree in a data science-related field (e.g., computer science, cognitive science, IT, mathematics/statistics, economics).
Advanced Python programming skills.
Proficient in Data Science skills – ML frameworks (scikit-learn, deep learning frameworks), data wrangling, data analysis, and visualization.
Experienced with the following technologies: SQL, Web APIs, Git, Linux commands.
Excellent English communication skills with the ability to present complex data clearly to non-technical stakeholders.
Show genuine care for both team dynamics and the success of the organization, fostering a positive and inclusive work culture.


Preferred Qualifications


Prior working experience in applying data science, with a focus on machine learning and predictive modeling.
Familiarity with the following technologies: MLOps, Spark, Cloud platform (e.g. Azure/AWS), mlflow, ETL processes, CI/CD processes.
Databricks environment for building and deploying ML models.
Leveraging LLMs for enhancing the performance of ML models through prompt engineering and embeddings.


Interested?

If you want to apply for the position, please follow the link and attach your CV.

To help us better understand your motivation and qualifications for this role, we kindly encourage you to attach both your cover letter and academic transcript. This will give us a clearer overview of your interests and the courses you have completed during your studies.

If you have any further questions about the role, please do not hesitate to contact the hiring manager,

Mihai Popovici, Advanced Analytics, Data Science & Tech Lead at mihai.popovici@abacusmedicine.com

Would you like to know more about us?

Follow us on Instagram and LinkedIn and get an insight into everyday life at Abacus Medicine. For job openings, check our Career page.

Moving Healthcare. Moving You.

In Abacus Medicine Group, you’ll experience the power of Moving Healthcare. With our change mindset, we're moving the industry and improving healthcare as we broaden access to medicine.

But it's not just about moving healthcare, it's about Moving You. You’ll be part of a caring community of more than 1,500 people across the World. With us, you will be valued, empowered, and have a direct impact on driving change. Let's access the future of medicine and make a difference together. Your move.

Please note that the position will remain open until we find the right candidate, after which the job advertisement will be removed. We encourage interested applicants to submit their applications as early as possible.

Please note that due to the upcoming summer holiday period, the recruitment process may take slightly longer than usual. We appreciate your patience and understanding.

Title: AI Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
AI Engineers (x2) – Product-Led Startup

60,000–80,000 DKK/month

Copenhagen (Hybrid – 3 to 4 days/week in office)




We’re helping a well-backed AI startup scale their core engineering team with two new hires – hands-on AI engineers who can contribute across the stack and help bring multiple live products to the next level.




This is a small, senior team where you’ll be working directly with founders, shipping production features fast, and playing a meaningful role in shaping the product and tech direction.




What we’re looking for:

Engineers with a strong product mindset and experience in fast-moving environments
Solid exposure to LLMs, RAG workflows, vector databases, or frameworks like Langchain
Comfortable working in .NET and React, but tech isn't everything – mindset is key
Cloud-first thinking – you’ve built and shipped systems, not just hooked into them
No freelancers or short-termers – we’re looking for people who’ve grown with a company




Tech environment:

RAG, Langchain, vector DBs
.NET
React




Even if you do not feel like you tick all of the boxes, please still apply - we'd love to hear from you!

Title: AI Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
AI Engineer – Internal AI Workflows (Python)




📍 Copenhagen | Hybrid

We’re going AI-first, and we need someone who has already shipped real products with AI agents, LLMs, and automation tooling.




If you’ve built with GPT, Claude, Cursor, LangChain, or similar, integrating APIs, orchestrating AI-driven processes, or creating production-ready AI flows, this is your stage.




Our Mission

We’re building the most advanced, intelligent product lifecycle management (PLM) platform for the fashion and lifestyle industry.




Our customers are global brands and suppliers who collaborate, manage collections, and streamline every stage from concept to finished product.




We digitize workflows, optimize resources, and enable better, faster decisions with AI.

This is not a research role. You’ll be shipping working AI-powered tools, quickly, and delivering immediate impact.




What You’ll Do

Design, build, and maintain internal AI-driven tooling that improves developer experience, optimizes workflows, and streamlines internal operations.
Drive the introduction and adoption of AI tools (e.g., GPT-4o, Claude, Cursor, LangChain, n8n) across engineering and business teams.
Automate processes ranging from product data enrichment to supplier communication flows, reducing manual effort and improving speed.
Create end-to-end Python solutions that integrate AI models, automation frameworks, and business logic.
Translate real needs from product, customer success, and support teams into prompt-driven utilities, scripts, and microservices.
Connect Python-based AI services to our platform via REST APIs, webhooks, and Azure services.
Collaborate closely with the founder, product, and engineering teams to identify high-impact AI opportunities.
Document, test, and scale AI workflows so they can be rolled out across teams, customers, and geographies.
(Optional) Build simple internal UIs or dashboards with Retool or other low/no-code tools to make AI-powered tools accessible to non-technical users.




Who You Are

3–5 years of relevant experience building production software with AI agents, automation, or prompt-based tools, or equivalent real-world project experience.
Proven track record shipping AI workflows, whether that’s an agent, automation pipeline, prompt-driven integration, or API-connected AI system.
Strong Python development skills, ideally with experience in:
LangChain, LlamaIndex, or similar frameworks
REST API integration and orchestration
Azure Functions, Azure SQL, or other cloud-based data/storage
Comfortable working with LLM orchestration tools like LangChain, GPT function calling, Claude code execution, or Cursor’s AI-assisted coding workflows.
You think in systems, seeing the flow between tools, prompts, users, and data.
Bonus: Experience with PLM, supply chain, or fashion/lifestyle industry workflows.




Why Join Us

Build real-world AI tools, not gimmicks.
Small, ambitious, product-driven team with deep market traction.
Your code will be used daily by brands and suppliers worldwide.
Influence how AI is applied in one of the most operationally complex and underserved industries: product development and collaboration.
Full autonomy, minimal bureaucracy, and rapid feedback loops.




Tech Stack You’ll Touch

Python (FastAPI, Flask, or similar)
GPT-4o / OpenAI Functions / Claude
LangChain / LlamaIndex / n8n
Azure Functions, Azure SQL, Azure Storage
REST APIs (internal & external)
Retool / low-code tools (optional)
Any other frameworks that make us faster and smarter




Compensation

Competitive salary based on experience
Office in central Copenhagen with hybrid flexibility
Real ownership. No bureaucracy.




📩 Contact hiring manager Luqman Mohammed-Brown at L.Mohammed-Brown@tenthrevolution.com for questions.

Show more

  • Azure Functions, Azure SQL, Azure Storage

Title: AI Research Engineer
Description:
Join Tether and Shape the Future of Digital Finance

At Tether, we’re not just building products, we’re pioneering a global financial revolution. Our cutting-edge solutions empower businesses—from exchanges and wallets to payment processors and ATMs—to seamlessly integrate reserve-backed tokens across blockchains. By harnessing the power of blockchain technology, Tether enables you to store, send, and receive digital tokens instantly, securely, and globally, all at a fraction of the cost. Transparency is the bedrock of everything we do, ensuring trust in every transaction.

Innovate with Tether

Tether Finance: Our innovative product suite features the world’s most trusted stablecoin, USDT, relied upon by hundreds of millions worldwide, alongside pioneering digital asset tokenization services.

But that’s just the beginning:

Tether Power: Driving sustainable growth, our energy solutions optimize excess power for Bitcoin mining using eco-friendly practices in state-of-the-art, geo-diverse facilities.

Tether Data: Fueling breakthroughs in AI and peer-to-peer technology, we reduce infrastructure costs and enhance global communications with cutting-edge solutions like KEET, our flagship app that redefines secure and private data sharing.

Tether Education: Democratizing access to top-tier digital learning, we empower individuals to thrive in the digital and gig economies, driving global growth and opportunity.

Tether Evolution: At the intersection of technology and human potential, we are pushing the boundaries of what is possible, crafting a future where innovation and human capabilities merge in powerful, unprecedented ways.

Why Join Us?

Our team is a global talent powerhouse, working remotely from every corner of the world. If you’re passionate about making a mark in the fintech space, this is your opportunity to collaborate with some of the brightest minds, pushing boundaries and setting new standards. We’ve grown fast, stayed lean, and secured our place as a leader in the industry.

If you have excellent English communication skills and are ready to contribute to the most innovative platform on the planet, Tether is the place for you.

Are you ready to be part of the future?

About the job:

As a member of the AI model team, you will drive innovation in architecture development for cutting-edge models of various scales, including small, large, and multi-modal systems. Your work will enhance intelligence, improve efficiency, and introduce new capabilities to advance the field.

You will have a deep expertise in LLM architectures, a strong grasp of pre-training optimization with a hands-on, research-driven approach. Your mission is to explore and implement novel techniques and algorithms that lead to groundbreaking advancements: data curation, strengthening baselines, identifying and resolving existing pre-training bottlenecks to push the limits of AI performance.

Responsibilities:


Conduct pre-training AI models on large, distributed servers equipped with thousands of NVIDIA GPUs.
Design, prototype, and scale innovative architectures to enhance model intelligence.
Independently and collaboratively execute experiments, analyze results, and refine methodologies for optimal performance.
Investigate, debug, and improve both model efficiency and computational performance.
Contribute to the advancement of training systems to ensure seamless scalability and efficiency on target platforms.
A degree in Computer Science or related field. Ideally PhD in NLP, Machine Learning, or a related field, complemented by a solid track record in AI R&D (with good publications in A* conferences).
Hands-on experience contributing to large-scale LLM training runs on large, distributed servers equipped with thousands of NVIDIA GPUs, ensuring scalability and impactful advancements in model performance.
Familiarity and practical experience with large-scale, distributed training frameworks, libraries and tools.
Deep knowledge of state-of-the-art transformer and non-transformer modifications aimed at enhancing intelligence, efficiency and scalability.
Strong expertise in PyTorch and Hugging Face libraries with practical experience in model development, continual pretraining, and deployment.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Her er vores CV

Når nu vi beder dig om et CV, er det vist kun fair, at du også får vores.

Vi hedder Vertica, og vi er en højt specialiseret virksomhed inden for digital forretningsudvikling og ecommerce-løsninger. Vi har mere end 20 års erfaring, og vi har lige nu ansvaret for 150 verticanere fordelt på vores kontorer i hjertet af Aarhus og Kødbyen i København.

Vi har lavet prisvindende ecommerce-løsninger for nogle af de største og mest ambitiøse e-handelsvirksomheder i Danmark såsom Søstrene Grene, Brødrene Dahl, Hørkram og Louis Poulsen. Arbejde, der kræver bred faglig viden om alt fra teknisk forretningsudvikling, softwareudvikling og QA til projektledelse, UX og digitalt design.

Vi tror meget på vigtigheden af en god arbejdskultur, og vi er stolte af at have bygget en, der beror på faglig stolthed, videndeling, personlig udvikling og flere sociale arrangementer, end du nogensinde får tid til.

Så vi kan lidt af hvert, og vi synes, du skal vælge os.

Din nye hverdag

Som en del af vores AI og Data-team arbejder du sammen med et team af kolleger med forskellig baggrund og kompetencer. Det, der binder jer sammen, er jeres store interesse for data, AI og forretningsudvikling – og hvordan vi i Vertica kan hjælpe vores kunder med at omsætte data til vigtige indsigter, som kan være med til at flytte og styrke vores kunders forretning. I din rolle kommer du med det rette data på det rette tidspunkt og i den rette kvalitet. Du skaber således et stærkt fundament for, at vores kunder har nem adgang til at arbejde med data. Da vi er en konsulentvirksomhed, vil vores opgaver variere afhængigt af vores kunders behov. Dog kan vi fortælle, at vores fokus er at udvikle AI løsninger til ecommerce, hvor vi laver alt fra conversational agents til dynamisk prissætning.

Vi forestiller os, at du skal arbejde med følgende.



Designe, bygge og levere værdiskabende AI løsninger til en bred række af kunder i samarbejde med resten af AI og Data teamet 
Være med til at finde de bedste løsninger baseret på kundernes ønsker og behov
Udvikle og implementere robuste metoder til evaluering og overvågning, så vi sikrer høj kvalitet i vores løsninger.
Udvikle produktionsklar Python kode 
Bidrage til at definere best practices og standarder for data science i organisationen
Følge og arbejde på projekter fra start til slut samt endeligt at sætte løsningen i produktion



Dit fundament

Vi forestiller os, at du har minimum 3 års relevant erhvervserfaring samt har et solidt teknisk grundlag og evnerne og forståelsen for at drive processer fra start til slut. Men vigtigst af alt er, at du er passioneret omkring AI og har lyst til at drive vores forretning til nye højder sammen med resten af teamet.

Det er et plus, hvis du har erfaring med hele machine learning lifecycle eller har erfaring med at arbejde med forskellige dataplatforme.

Derudover lægger vi vægt på, at:



Du har erfaring som konsulent og motiveres af at arbejde med AI projekter samt hjælpe kunder med at finde den bedste løsning til deres udfordringer  
Du har erfaring med at sætte machine learning modeller eller AI løsninger i produktion   
Du har stærke færdigheder og god erfaring med Python 
Du har flair og interesse for at arbejde med en bred vifte af AI løsninger



Fik vi nævnt…

At vi ikke har nogen chefer. Her er der ingen, der bestemmer, hvordan du skal arbejde. Vi har sat beslutningerne fri, så dem der har faglighed og kompetence selv bestemmer, hvordan de løser opgaverne. Det betyder, at du og dit team får mulighed for at indrette jeres arbejde, sådan som I mener, det er bedst.   

At gennemsigtighed er en af kerneværdierne i Vertica, og derfor ligger vores personalehåndbog frit tilgængeligt online. I personalehåndbogen kan du læse, hvilke vilkår vi - og alle vores fremtidige kolleger - arbejder under. Hvis ikke du har tid til at læse hele håndbogen igennem, så har vi fremhævet nogle af dem, vi sætter særligt pris på.

At vi tror på livslang læring: Vi går i livets skole, men af og til er der også kurser, konferencer eller uddannelser, som man kan lære af. Er der noget, du gerne vil blive klogere på, har du muligheden for at videreuddanne dig i Vertica. Vi har intet loft på uddannelsesbudgettet, så der heller ikke er loft på læringen.

At vi er hamrende sociale: Vi holder af sociale arrangementer, og vi holder mange af dem. Det kan være alt fra klatring, padeltennis, byg-dit-eget-tastatur og cocktail-kursus til familietur i Djurs Sommerland. Derudover tager vi hvert år på en firmaweekend, hvor vi har fokus på hygge, god mad og socialt samvær.

At vi er hele mennesker på arbejde: Vi tror på at der er andet i livet end arbejde og derfor er det vigtigt for os, at vi holder os inden for en 37-timers arbejdsuge, og at vi behandler hinanden med stor ordentlighed og respekt
Show more
HTML:
Her er vores CV

Når nu vi beder dig om et CV, er det vist kun fair, at du også får vores.

Vi hedder Vertica, og vi er en højt specialiseret virksomhed inden for digital forretningsudvikling og ecommerce-løsninger. Vi har mere end 20 års erfaring, og vi har lige nu ansvaret for 150 verticanere fordelt på vores kontorer i hjertet af Aarhus og Kødbyen i København.

Vi har lavet prisvindende ecommerce-løsninger for nogle af de største og mest ambitiøse e-handelsvirksomheder i Danmark såsom Søstrene Grene, Brødrene Dahl, Hørkram og Louis Poulsen. Arbejde, der kræver bred faglig viden om alt fra teknisk forretningsudvikling, softwareudvikling og QA til projektledelse, UX og digitalt design.

Vi tror meget på vigtigheden af en god arbejdskultur, og vi er stolte af at have bygget en, der beror på faglig stolthed, videndeling, personlig udvikling og flere sociale arrangementer, end du nogensinde får tid til.

Så vi kan lidt af hvert, og vi synes, du skal vælge os.

Din nye hverdag

Som en del af vores AI og Data-team arbejder du sammen med et team af kolleger med forskellig baggrund og kompetencer. Det, der binder jer sammen, er jeres store interesse for data, AI og forretningsudvikling – og hvordan vi i Vertica kan hjælpe vores kunder med at omsætte data til vigtige indsigter, som kan være med til at flytte og styrke vores kunders forretning. I din rolle kommer du med det rette data på det rette tidspunkt og i den rette kvalitet. Du skaber således et stærkt fundament for, at vores kunder har nem adgang til at arbejde med data. Da vi er en konsulentvirksomhed, vil vores opgaver variere afhængigt af vores kunders behov. Dog kan vi fortælle, at vores fokus er at udvikle AI løsninger til ecommerce, hvor vi laver alt fra conversational agents til dynamisk prissætning.

Vi forestiller os, at du skal arbejde med følgende.


  • Designe, bygge og levere værdiskabende AI løsninger til en bred række af kunder i samarbejde med resten af AI og Data teamet 
  • Være med til at finde de bedste løsninger baseret på kundernes ønsker og behov
  • Udvikle og implementere robuste metoder til evaluering og overvågning, så vi sikrer høj kvalitet i vores løsninger.
  • Udvikle produktionsklar Python kode 
  • Bidrage til at definere best practices og standarder for data science i organisationen
  • Følge og arbejde på projekter fra start til slut samt endeligt at sætte løsningen i produktion


Dit fundament

Vi forestiller os, at du har minimum 3 års relevant erhvervserfaring samt har et solidt teknisk grundlag og evnerne og forståelsen for at drive processer fra start til slut. Men vigtigst af alt er, at du er passioneret omkring AI og har lyst til at drive vores forretning til nye højder sammen med resten af teamet.

Det er et plus, hvis du har erfaring med hele machine learning lifecycle eller har erfaring med at arbejde med forskellige dataplatforme.

Derudover lægger vi vægt på, at:


  • Du har erfaring som konsulent og motiveres af at arbejde med AI projekter samt hjælpe kunder med at finde den bedste løsning til deres udfordringer  
  • Du har erfaring med at sætte machine learning modeller eller AI løsninger i produktion   
  • Du har stærke færdigheder og god erfaring med Python 
  • Du har flair og interesse for at arbejde med en bred vifte af AI løsninger


Fik vi nævnt…

At vi ikke har nogen chefer. Her er der ingen, der bestemmer, hvordan du skal arbejde. Vi har sat beslutningerne fri, så dem der har faglighed og kompetence selv bestemmer, hvordan de løser opgaverne. Det betyder, at du og dit team får mulighed for at indrette jeres arbejde, sådan som I mener, det er bedst.   

At gennemsigtighed er en af kerneværdierne i Vertica, og derfor ligger vores personalehåndbog frit tilgængeligt online. I personalehåndbogen kan du læse, hvilke vilkår vi - og alle vores fremtidige kolleger - arbejder under. Hvis ikke du har tid til at læse hele håndbogen igennem, så har vi fremhævet nogle af dem, vi sætter særligt pris på.

At vi tror på livslang læring: Vi går i livets skole, men af og til er der også kurser, konferencer eller uddannelser, som man kan lære af. Er der noget, du gerne vil blive klogere på, har du muligheden for at videreuddanne dig i Vertica. Vi har intet loft på uddannelsesbudgettet, så der heller ikke er loft på læringen.

At vi er hamrende sociale: Vi holder af sociale arrangementer, og vi holder mange af dem. Det kan være alt fra klatring, padeltennis, byg-dit-eget-tastatur og cocktail-kursus til familietur i Djurs Sommerland. Derudover tager vi hvert år på en firmaweekend, hvor vi har fokus på hygge, god mad og socialt samvær.

At vi er hele mennesker på arbejde: Vi tror på at der er andet i livet end arbejde og derfor er det vigtigt for os, at vi holder os inden for en 37-timers arbejdsuge, og at vi behandler hinanden med stor ordentlighed og respekt

Title: AI & Machine Learning Engineer at new Human-Centered Social Network Startup
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Lifebonder, we’re on a mission to break social media addiction, fake personas, cyber-bullying, cancel culture, and loneliness by providing a Mesaverse that lives up to the promise of what social media can be: A safe place to facilitate human connections rather than replace them.

We want to make the world a better place by filling a growing need for direct socializing outside social media - connecting people in friendships that are human, profound, and meaningful. LifeBonder makes it easy for people to connect in a deeper reality through shared spaces, values, and goals because our vision is to build social bonds in real life.

Note: This is an UNPAID volunteer opportunity!

Job brief

We are actively searching for a talented and experienced AI and Machine Learning (ML) Engineer to join our team.

As an AI and Machine Learning Engineer, you will play a crucial role in the development and implementation of cutting-edge artificial intelligence.

Your responsibilities will involve designing and constructing sophisticated machine learning models, as well as refining and updating systems.

In order to thrive in this position, you must possess exceptional skills in statistics and programming, as well as a deep understanding of data science and software engineering principles.

Your ultimate objective will be to create highly efficient self-learning applications that can adapt and evolve over time, pushing the boundaries of AI technology. Join us and be at the forefront of innovation in the field of machine learning.

Responsibilities


Study and transform data science prototypes
Design machine learning systems
Research and implement appropriate AI models and ML algorithms and tools
Develop machine learning application according to requirements
Select appropriate datasets and data representation methods
Run machine learning tests and experiments
Perform statistical analysis and fine-tuning using test results
Train and retrain systems when necessary
Extend existing ML libraries and frameworks
Keep abreast of developments in the field


Requirements And Skills


Proven experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or similar role
Understanding of data structures, data modeling and software architecture
Deep knowledge of math, probability, statistics and algorithms
Ability to write robust code in Python, Java and R
Familiarity with machine learning frameworks (like Keras or PyTorch) and libraries (like scikit-learn)
Excellent communication skills
Ability to work in a team
Outstanding analytical and problem-solving skills
BSc in Computer Science, Mathematics or similar field; Master’s degree is a plus


What We Offer


We are a small team of endlessly dedicated developers offering a fun and friendly work environment where everyone is equal.
We offer real-world work experience and exciting challenges where you can make a real difference.
Excellent recommendations and when you’re ready to move on, we’ve got your back.
Full-time hires at a later date.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist in the Explorative Biochemical Analytics Department, R&D Novonesis
Place: Hørsholm, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you ready for a new beginning?

We need your talent, knowledge and dedication to better our world with biology.

Our purpose points the way

In Novonesis, we know that solutions rooted in biology can help solve humanity’s biggest challenges. Since we began more than a century ago, this has been our guide. It’s how we've gotten so far. And it’s how we'll impact the future. Now, more than ever, the world needs change. And with biosolutions, the possibilities for transformation are endless.

We’re here to better our world with biology.

Join us as our new Data Scientist in the Explorative Biochemical Analytics Department, R&D Novonesis

Are you passionate about developing data flows, and solving real-world problems in biotechnology using data-driven decisions? Do you have experience with databases and a mindset for creating solutions for users to work smarter and not harder? Then you might be our new data scientist.

We’re looking for a Data Scientist who thrives in a collaborative environment and is excited to work across a broad variety of data types and scientific workflows. You’ll play a key role advancing our digital infrastructure by designing data pipelines and creating intuitive visualizations to support our scientists and business stakeholders. Furthermore, you will be anchored in key R&D projects to contribute with advanced data analysis for the development of new biosolutions.

Welcome to Explorative Biochemical Analytics Department

The Explorative Biochemical Analytics Department develops biochemical methods and provides qualitative and quantitative data of small molecules, peptides, proteins and polysaccharides in biological matrices for use in projects and product development.

We primarily use liquid chromatography as separation technique and mass spectrometry, UV, infrared spectroscopy, and light scattering for detection. We are active in many projects to accelerate mode of action understanding and to improve the chemical characterization of existing and future enzymatic and microbial products.

Key Responsibilities


Design and implement data pipelines for diverse biochemical analyses, ensuring seamless integration between our laboratories and data infrastructure.
Collaborate closely with scientists and lab technicians to understand experimental workflows, ensure accurate data capture, and provide tailored data solutions to support research objectives.
Build data solutions and interactive visualizations to provide researchers with “one-click” access to analyses, dashboards, and metrics.
Collaborate with scientists to solve data challenges (e.g., developing apps, datasets, performing biochemical data analysis, etc).
Represent the team in data governance initiatives across Novonesis
Provide mentorship and training to team members on data science methodologies, tools, and best practices.
Define and implement best practices for managing FAIR biochemical data.


To Succeed You Must Hold


Bachelor’s degree in biology, biotechnology, bioinformatics, pharma, or similar field, with strong biological literacy.
Master’s degree in data science or related discipline with 3+ years of experience working in this area.
Proficiency in Python for data analysis and app development.
Experience working with SQL and relational databases.
Experience working with unstructured or semi-structured data from laboratory systems, instruments, or experimental outputs.
A strong communicator who can collaborate with colleagues from a variety of backgrounds including chemists, microbiologists, lab technicians and IT professionals.


Other Skills That Are Preferable


Hands-on experience building apps using Dash, Streamlit, or similar platforms.
Strong foundation in statistics and multivariate data analysis techniques.
Practical experience in applying machine learning techniques (e.g., regression, classification, clustering) to analyze and interpret complex biological or biochemical datasets.
Experience working with large-scale scientific datasets, such as omics data, or time-series laboratory data.


Location: This job will be located at Novonesis Innovation Campus in Hørsholm, Denmark.

Application deadline: August 25th 2025. Please apply as soon as possible as we will continuously screen the applicants.

Contact details: Department Manager Bruna Marques dos Santos, e-mail: bmds@novonesis.com

Could our purpose be yours? Then apply today!

At Novonesis we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. We recommend you not to attach a cover letter to your application. Instead, please include a few sentences in your resume/CV about why you are applying. To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your resume/CV.

Novonesis is dedicated to fostering a unique community by embracing and respecting differences. We make all employment decisions based on business needs, ensuring that every individual can thrive, regardless of identity or background such as ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability, or veteran status.

Want to learn more?

Learn more about Novonesis, our purpose, and your career opportunities at novonesis.com

Not the right fit for you?

Even if this job isn't the right fit for you, perhaps you know someone who might find it interesting. If so, please feel free to share the job link and encourage them to apply. Thank you for your referral! Please check out our other open positions. The right fit for you could just be a few clicks away.

Stay alert: Avoid recruitment scams

At Novonesis, We Are Committed To Maintaining a Safe And Transparent Recruitment Process. Please Be Aware Of Potential Scams Targeting Job Seekers And Take Note Of The Following


Novonesis will never ask for sensitive personal information, such as bank account details, Social Security numbers, or passwords, at any stage of the hiring process.
Novonesis does not make employment offers without conducting interviews with candidates.


If you receive suspicious communication claiming to be from Novonesis, please do not share any personal or financial information. We encourage you to verify the legitimacy of the message by contacting us directly through our official channels.
Show more

Title: Freelance Software Developer (Python Engineer) - AI Trainer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

We are looking for an experienced Python developer who enjoys building tools, environments, and infrastructure for working with LLM-based agents. You'll help create sandboxes, task systems, and CI/CD pipelines to support testing and development of AI agents. You'll also work closely with researchers and domain experts, helping them set up and use these tools effectively.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Sandboxes for running and testing AI agents safely
Tools for writing tasks and test cases for agents
CI/CD pipelines to run checks and evaluate agents
Dev environments for experts creating these tasks
Repo templates and scripts to help new contributors
Interfaces for tracking task input and agent results
Example Tasks


How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Software Development, Computer Science, or other related fields.
You have 5+ years of experience writing Python code
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge


Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments.
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio.
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
Show more
