Title: Process Data Scientist
Place: Hillerød, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for a Process Data Scientist to help us translate our manufacturing and supporting processes pain points, into first class Manufacturing Intelligence Use Cases via data analytics /science. If you thrive by being a key stakeholder in establishing the site’s process data, then you just might be a great colleague to our highly skilled Process Analytics organization.

Your New Role

The Process Data Scientist is a critical role within FUJIFILM Biotechnologies Denmark (FDBD) as the business is expanding and we are introducing new technologies, programs, and customers continuously – with data excellence being one of the mission enablers. We will provide ongoing support to our new site in Holly Springs, NC, USA.

You will be a key stakeholder in establishing the site’s process data usage and analytics value chain, whilst being the owner of already validated monitoring applications, e.g., an electronic chromatogram review setup and machine learning batch performance models. We continuously strive to identify opportunities to improve internal systems and practices, as well as provide direction and development of digital/data offerings to our partners.

Your Primary Tasks Will Be


Support process investigations, root cause analysis, optimization with data support and analysis
Process Analytics systems support to manufacturing across all product modalities
Develop, validate, and deploy ETL pipelines and help build the process data ecosystem
Support process trending, continued process verification (CPV) and annual product reviews (APQR)
Support development of applications with models for process characterization and scale-up/out
Develop, validate, and deploy multivariate batch monitoring models
Support innovation and systems improvement initiatives in the Process Analytics space



The Skills & Knowledge We Hope You Possess


You have a master’s degree in in a relevant science or engineering discipline (i.e., Engineering, Bioinformatics or similar) with 2 years of industry experience or a Bachelors in the same area with 4 years of industry experience.
You have working-knowledge of SQL and a solid understanding of data science and the Python data science ecosystem (NumPy, SciPy, pandas, Scikit-learn, Jupyter Notebook).
Familiarity with SIMCA-online, TIBCO Statistica, Visual Basic and Git version control are a plus.
It would be considered an advantage if you also have GMP experience, having worked on delivering GxP applications.



We value candidates who are naturally curious, greet people with a smile, and possess a can-do attitude. You demonstrate humility and respect for those around you. As someone who is pragmatic and structured, you have a keen focus on quality and enjoy working independently. You are proactive in dynamic entrepreneurial environments. Most importantly, you possess strong communication skills and appreciate the support of a cross-functional team.

The team

The Process Analytics team is embedded in the Process Science (PS) organization and provide leadership and subject matter expertise to existing production-ready process data business processes, while also seeking to develop and introduce new Manufacturing Intelligence in clinical, PPQ and commercial processes primarily in the large-scale Cell Culture manufacturing.

We are a growing team of highly professional dedicated scientists/engineers with data management and data science expertise - but also broad experience within pharmaceutical development and manufacturing of monoclonal antibodies.

The work environment is international and informal. The role is based in our Hillerød, Denmark location, and we offer a flexible work arrangement where a defined number of working hours can be carried out in the employee’s home.

We keep a high pace and focus on a vital work life balance while having fun. We put a strong emphasis on psychological safety through trust and empowerment within our teams and hope that this is something that speaks to you as well.

Application

Has this sparked your interest, then please upload your CV and cover letter as soon as possible, as we screen candidates on a continuous basis and call in for interviews.

The Company

FUJIFILM Biotechnologies is an industry-leading Biologics Contract Development and Manufacturing Organization (CDMO) with locations in Hillerød, Denmark, Teesside, UK, RTP, North Carolina and College Station, Texas, USA. We use our skills, dedication, and ambition to enable impact for the world’s most innovative biotech and biopharma companies reimagining healthcare’s potential. We work across the entire lifecycle of our customers’ products – enabling success throughout. Every cure, vaccine, biologic, and advancement we contribute to starts with our people and our passion. We fuel one another’s passion, help accelerate progress, expand capabilities, strengthen innovation, and improve processes to improve lives.

We offer the chance to be part of a global workplace where passion, drive and commitment are met with opportunities for professional and personal development. Deeply committed to diversity and inclusion, we ensure that everyone no matter their background or gender has an opportunity to develop. We take pride in enriching our communities, caring for our environment, and cultivating a world of opportunity for future generations.

We aim to foster a collaborative, innovative and rewarding environment, where diverse perspectives and people come together united by a common purpose and shared values. We pursue our fullest potential as individual contributors and team members. We strive to be the employer of choice and offer a competitive compensation and benefit package.

FUJIFILM Biotechnologies Denmark (FDBD) is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identify or any other protected class.

To all agencies: Please, no phone calls or emails to any employee of FUJIFILM about this requisition. All resumes submitted by search firms/employment agencies to any employee at FUJIFILM via-email, the internet or in any form and/or method will be deemed the sole property of FUJIFILM, unless such search firms/employment agencies were engaged by FUJIFILM for this requisition and a valid agreement with FUJIFILM is in place. In the event a candidate who was submitted outside of the FUJIFILM agency engagement process is hired, no fee or payment of any kind will be paid.
Show more
HTML:
We are looking for a Process Data Scientist to help us translate our manufacturing and supporting processes pain points, into first class Manufacturing Intelligence Use Cases via data analytics /science. If you thrive by being a key stakeholder in establishing the site’s process data, then you just might be a great colleague to our highly skilled Process Analytics organization.

Your New Role

The Process Data Scientist is a critical role within FUJIFILM Biotechnologies Denmark (FDBD) as the business is expanding and we are introducing new technologies, programs, and customers continuously – with data excellence being one of the mission enablers. We will provide ongoing support to our new site in Holly Springs, NC, USA.

You will be a key stakeholder in establishing the site’s process data usage and analytics value chain, whilst being the owner of already validated monitoring applications, e.g., an electronic chromatogram review setup and machine learning batch performance models. We continuously strive to identify opportunities to improve internal systems and practices, as well as provide direction and development of digital/data offerings to our partners.

Your Primary Tasks Will Be

  • Support process investigations, root cause analysis, optimization with data support and analysis
  • Process Analytics systems support to manufacturing across all product modalities
  • Develop, validate, and deploy ETL pipelines and help build the process data ecosystem
  • Support process trending, continued process verification (CPV) and annual product reviews (APQR)
  • Support development of applications with models for process characterization and scale-up/out
  • Develop, validate, and deploy multivariate batch monitoring models
  • Support innovation and systems improvement initiatives in the Process Analytics space


The Skills & Knowledge We Hope You Possess

  • You have a master’s degree in in a relevant science or engineering discipline (i.e., Engineering, Bioinformatics or similar) with 2 years of industry experience or a Bachelors in the same area with 4 years of industry experience.
  • You have working-knowledge of SQL and a solid understanding of data science and the Python data science ecosystem (NumPy, SciPy, pandas, Scikit-learn, Jupyter Notebook).
  • Familiarity with SIMCA-online, TIBCO Statistica, Visual Basic and Git version control are a plus.
  • It would be considered an advantage if you also have GMP experience, having worked on delivering GxP applications.


We value candidates who are naturally curious, greet people with a smile, and possess a can-do attitude. You demonstrate humility and respect for those around you. As someone who is pragmatic and structured, you have a keen focus on quality and enjoy working independently. You are proactive in dynamic entrepreneurial environments. Most importantly, you possess strong communication skills and appreciate the support of a cross-functional team.

The team

The Process Analytics team is embedded in the Process Science (PS) organization and provide leadership and subject matter expertise to existing production-ready process data business processes, while also seeking to develop and introduce new Manufacturing Intelligence in clinical, PPQ and commercial processes primarily in the large-scale Cell Culture manufacturing.

We are a growing team of highly professional dedicated scientists/engineers with data management and data science expertise - but also broad experience within pharmaceutical development and manufacturing of monoclonal antibodies.

The work environment is international and informal. The role is based in our Hillerød, Denmark location, and we offer a flexible work arrangement where a defined number of working hours can be carried out in the employee’s home.

We keep a high pace and focus on a vital work life balance while having fun. We put a strong emphasis on psychological safety through trust and empowerment within our teams and hope that this is something that speaks to you as well.

Application

Has this sparked your interest, then please upload your CV and cover letter as soon as possible, as we screen candidates on a continuous basis and call in for interviews.

The Company

FUJIFILM Biotechnologies is an industry-leading Biologics Contract Development and Manufacturing Organization (CDMO) with locations in Hillerød, Denmark, Teesside, UK, RTP, North Carolina and College Station, Texas, USA. We use our skills, dedication, and ambition to enable impact for the world’s most innovative biotech and biopharma companies reimagining healthcare’s potential. We work across the entire lifecycle of our customers’ products – enabling success throughout. Every cure, vaccine, biologic, and advancement we contribute to starts with our people and our passion. We fuel one another’s passion, help accelerate progress, expand capabilities, strengthen innovation, and improve processes to improve lives.

We offer the chance to be part of a global workplace where passion, drive and commitment are met with opportunities for professional and personal development. Deeply committed to diversity and inclusion, we ensure that everyone no matter their background or gender has an opportunity to develop. We take pride in enriching our communities, caring for our environment, and cultivating a world of opportunity for future generations.

We aim to foster a collaborative, innovative and rewarding environment, where diverse perspectives and people come together united by a common purpose and shared values. We pursue our fullest potential as individual contributors and team members. We strive to be the employer of choice and offer a competitive compensation and benefit package.

FUJIFILM Biotechnologies Denmark (FDBD) is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identify or any other protected class.

All resumes submitted by search firms/employment agencies to any employee at FUJIFILM via-email, the internet or in any form and/or method will be deemed the sole property of FUJIFILM, unless such search firms/employment agencies were engaged by FUJIFILM for this requisition and a valid agreement with FUJIFILM is in place. Title: AI Data Scientist
Description:
Vil du være med til at bygge CEGOs første AI-løsninger helt fra bunden? Vi søger en AI Data Scientist, der vil være med til at sætte retningen for vores nye AI-satsning og skabe intelligente systemer baseret på LLM’er og AI-agenter - direkte ind i hjertet af vores tech-platform.




Om CEGO

CEGO er en ambitiøs softwarevirksomhed beliggende på havnefronten i Aalborg. Vi har en uformel arbejdskultur med højt til loftet, fleksibilitet og frihed under ansvar. Vi driver Spilnu.dk, et af Danmarks største online casinoer, og har udvidet vores succes til England med Happy Tiger. Vi udvikler alt in-house ved hjælp af open source-teknologier - både spil, platform og nu også vores AI-initiativer.




Om rollen

Vi søger en AI Data Scientist til en nyoprettet rolle på kontoret i Aalborg, hvor du skal udvikle fremtidens AI-løsninger med fokus på brug af Large Language Models (LLMs), AI-agenter og moderne AI-arkitekturer.




Det er en pionérrolle, hvor du bliver vores første specialist indenfor dette felt. Du vil bringe en ny teknologisk værktøjskasse med dig og forme, hvordan vi anvender AI hos CEGO. Samtidig vil du arbejde tæt sammen med vores dygtige udviklere i Platform-afdelingen, som bidrager med solid teknisk sparring. Du skal dog trives med at være frontløber og være komfortabel med at bane vejen i et nyt område.




Du bliver en del af vores Platform-afdeling, der består af 38 medarbejdere, herunder devops, softwareudviklere, UX-designere og frontend-udviklere.




Dine primære arbejdsopgaver omfatter:

Udvikle og implementere AI-løsninger baseret på LLM’er, AI-agenter og machine learning-teknikker såsom fine-tuning, prompt engineering, RAG (Retriever-Augmented Generation), ReACT og meta-prompting
Designe og optimere agentbaserede systemer med teknologier som fx LangChain, LangGraph og LangSmith eller lignende
Udvikle API’er og integrationer til at forbinde AI-løsninger med vores eksisterende systemer
Deltagelse i innovation og prototyping på tværs af teams og forretningsområder
Holde dig opdateret på relevante AI-trends og vurdere, hvordan de kan anvendes til at skabe værdi for forretningen.




Om dig

Vi forestiller os, at du er en initiativrig holdspiller, der kombinerer din udvikler-profil med et kommercielt mindset, og at du desuden har:




Grundlæggende forståelse for machine learning og evnen til at skelne mellem klassiske ML-problemer og moderne LLM-applikationer
Kender til teknikker som prompt chaining og retrieval-augmented generation (RAG)
Kendskab til agentbaserede AI-systemer og orkestrering af arbejdsgange
Erfaring med API-udvikling og softwareintegration
Erfaring med evaluering og performanceoptimering af AI-modeller
En nysgerrig og læringsorienteret tilgang til nye teknologier




Vi tilbyder

Mulighed for at blive en del af en af Aalborgs mest attraktive og ambitiøse arbejdspladser. Vi kombinerer en stærk faglig kultur med høj grad af frihed og ansvar.




En forretning, hvor kunderne er slutbrugerne på vores websites. Vi definerer således selv vores målsætninger, og i hvilken retning vi skal arbejde for at lykkes
Ingen tidsregistrering af arbejdsopgaverne
En agil, flad organisation med hurtige beslutningsveje
Fleksible arbejdstider, 30 minutters betalt daglig pause og en politik om nul overarbejde
Fælles morgenmad, adgang til fitnessrum, personlig træning to gange om ugen og massage
Et arbejdsmiljø hvor faglighed, trivsel og samarbejde går hånd i hånd
Sundhedsforsikring og pensionsordning




Vi ved, at dygtige og engagerede medarbejdere skaber de bedste resultater. Derfor gør vi en aktiv indsats for at sikre et arbejdsmiljø, hvor du både bliver udfordret og trives.




Ansøgning

Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte Chief People & Culture Officer Dorthe Hammer Hovaldt på dhhj@cego.dk eller tlf. +45 2140 0848.




Upload dit CV og en motiveret ansøgning via vores website hurtigst muligt - vi behandler ansøgninger løbende. Tiltrædelse er snarest muligt.




Vi opfordrer alle kvalificerede kandidater til at søge – uanset køn, alder, religion eller etnisk baggrund.




Virksomhedsbeskrivelse

CEGO A/S har eksisteret siden 2000 og driver i dag en række datterselskaber med forskellige online casinoer i såvel Danmark som internationalt. I 2012 lancerede vi Spilnu.dk, og vi var blandt de første der fik en casino-licens fra Spillemyndigheden, da den danske spillovgivning blev liberaliseret.




Spilnu.dk er unikke spillemaskiner, som alle er udviklet og produceret in-house. De er baseret på den klassiske "enarmede" fra spillehallen, som er tilsat en god dosis bonusspil, som giver en ekstra dimension til den klassiske spiltype og masser af ekstra underholdning. På Spilnu.dk er der fokus på hyggen og det sociale, hvor spillerne kan chatte med hinanden, mens de spiller.

Foruden Danmark opererer vi i UK, hvor du finder os under brandet Happy Tiger. CEGO A/S er ejet af tre Aalborgensiske iværksættere og VIA equity.




Du finder os i vores inspirerende kontor på havnefronten i Aalborg, hvor vi beskæftiger cirka 130 medarbejdere indenfor alt lige fra spiludvikling, webudvikling, spil- og lyddesign, grafik og kundeservice til serveradministration samt platform drift og -udvikling. Dertil kommer en række understøttende afdelinger i form af Compliance & Legal, Marketing, Økonomi og HR.

Show more

Title: Freelance Software Developer (Python Engineer) - AI Trainer
Description:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

We are looking for an experienced Python developer who enjoys building tools, environments, and infrastructure for working with LLM-based agents. You'll help create sandboxes, task systems, and CI/CD pipelines to support testing and development of AI agents. You'll also work closely with researchers and domain experts, helping them set up and use these tools effectively.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Sandboxes for running and testing AI agents safely
Tools for writing tasks and test cases for agents
CI/CD pipelines to run checks and evaluate agents
Dev environments for experts creating these tasks
Repo templates and scripts to help new contributors
Interfaces for tracking task input and agent results
Example Tasks


How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Software Development, Computer Science, or other related fields.
You have 5+ years of experience writing Python code
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge


Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments.
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio.
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise

Title: Data Scientist - Economic Consultant for leading brands
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join a growing team of Data Scientists transforming marketing for some of the world's largest brands

Join a team of expert Data Scientists and Consultants at Choreograph, a WPP Media company, revolutionizing marketing for the world's biggest brands. We transform data into powerful solutions for complex media and marketing challenges, leveraging cutting-edge techniques like econometrics, experiments, and strategic consulting. At Choreograph, you'll be at the forefront of industry innovation, partnering with leading advertisers, publishers, and tech companies to shape the future of marketing. This role offers unparalleled opportunities for professional and personal growth.

What You Will Do

As a Data Scientist on our team, you will:


Develop and implement data-driven solutions for various projects, including econometric modeling, attribution analysis, experimental design, algorithm development, and other data science initiatives.
Analyze large datasets, extract actionable insights, and package findings into compelling presentations for clients.
Collaborate with project teams to drive the development of automated reporting, algorithms, and other data science deliverables.
Contribute to a culture of innovation and continuous improvement within the team.


What You Will Bring


A strong academic background in mathematics, statistics, or a related field (e.g., cand.merc.(mat), cand.polit, Master's in Mathematics).
Proven experience or academic projects demonstrating proficiency in regression analysis and econometric modeling.
Proficiency in statistical software such as R and Python.
Experience with cloud environments (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) is advantageous but not required.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to clearly articulate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
A proactive and entrepreneurial mindset, with the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen eye for detail.
Fluency in English; Danish language skills are highly desirable.


Why Choreograph?


Impactful Work: Contribute to innovative projects that directly impact the success of leading brands.
Growth Opportunities: Develop your skills and advance your career within a supportive and collaborative environment. Gain exposure to cutting-edge technologies like cloud computing, machine learning, and automated data activation.
Dynamic Culture: Join a fun, casual, and social team that values collaboration and work-life balance. Enjoy regular social activities - from padel tennis and functional training to Friday afternoon socials.
Mentorship & Training: Benefit from ongoing training and mentorship from experienced colleagues.


About Us

At Choreograph, a WPP Media company, we are a team of passionate data experts driving real-world results in marketing effectiveness, customer insights, econometric modeling, and digital transformation.

Our Data Science team thrives in a collaborative environment with a vibrant social culture. You will get excellent training from day one and have opportunities to expand your skillset in cutting-edge areas like custom algorithms, cloud technology, and machine learning. We value a supportive and social atmosphere and believe in continuous learning and development within a fun, friendly team.

This is a full-time, permanent position based in Copenhagen, with a three-month probationary period. Apply now with your CV, cover letter and Grades

Contact

For questions about the position, please contact Marc Grün, Data Science Director, at marc.grun@Choreograph.com. (Please submit applications through the official channels, not via email).

  • Dynamic Culture: Join a fun, casual, and social team that values collaboration and work-life balance. Enjoy regular social activities - from padel tennis and functional training to Friday afternoon socials.
  • Mentorship & Training: Benefit from ongoing training and mentorship from experienced colleagues.

About Us

At Choreograph, a WPP Media company, we are a team of passionate data experts driving real-world results in marketing effectiveness, customer insights, econometric modeling, and digital transformation.

Our Data Science team thrives in a collaborative environment with a vibrant social culture. You will get excellent training from day one and have opportunities to expand your skillset in cutting-edge areas like custom algorithms, cloud technology, and machine learning. We value a supportive and social atmosphere and believe in continuous learning and development within a fun, friendly team.

This is a full-time, permanent position based in Copenhagen, with a three-month probationary period. Apply now with your CV, cover letter and Grades

Contact

For questions about the position, please contact Marc Grün, Data Science Director, at marc.grun@Choreograph.com. (Please submit applications through the official channels, not via email).

requisitionid:20868

Title: Freelance Software Developer (Python) - Quality Assurance (AI Trainer)
Description:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Coding, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Crafting and answering questions related to computer science in order to help train AI models to meet project-specific guidelines.
Evaluating and ranking code generated by AI models
Ensuring clarity, consistency, and factual accuracy.
Providing feedback to writers and working with QA Specialists to uphold quality


How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You are currently enrolled in or completed a Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science or a related field
You have at least 3 years of professional experience with Python
Experience with Cloud sourcing platform is a plus
Code review experience is a must
Experience with AI projects is a plus
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge


Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer, Computer Vision
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to develop computer vision and machine learning solutions for closing the gap between plan and reality for large scale construction projects, with the goal of minimizing waste through digitalization?

Your new role

Bringing data from offices to the construction site using 3D BIM models has long been part of our core expertise here at Dalux. Now, as one of the next steps in our effort to digitalize the construction industry, we are working to bring data from the construction site back into the office using modern Computer Vision techniques.

As a Machine Learning Engineer in our Computer Vision section, you will be a key part in delivery of the solutions into production. You will participate in the full lifecycle of the ML systems we build, while spearheading the model deployment, performance monitoring and maintenance, to ensure the reproducibility of our experiments and traceability of our pipelines in production. As part of the R&D team, you will be expected to keep up to date with the state-of-the-art in the ML/CV area as well as new techniques and processes.

Your background

We believe you…


Have 3+ years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, MLOps Engineer, or similar.
Have a proven track record of bringing machine learning models to production.
Have a solid theoretical foundation from a degree in computer science, engineering, IT or similar.
Can work both independently and as part of a team.


Most important is your problem-solving attitude, passion for software craftmanship, and the ambition to participate in the full lifecycle of our machine learning solutions.

Our tech...


Python
PyTorch
C++
OpenCV
AWS
MLFlow
Kubernetes


We are focused on using the right tools for the job, and as such the list of technologies may change depending on our needs and new offerings.

What To Expect As a Daluxian

In our organization the way from idea to product is short, combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.

You will become a part of a highly skilled team of passionate individuals driven by the wish to explore new and reshape existing technologies. As Dalux is a software company, we want half of the company to consist of Software Developers. All our software development happens at our head office at Vibenshuset in Copenhagen.

We offer...


Central location in Copenhagen, focus on work/life balance without any overtime, and no dress code.
An active social environment with monthly events and social clubs.
Flat communication in our organization, where the way from idea to product is short combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.
You’ll join a highly specialized, international team with room for creativity and professional growth.
Strong focus on diversity and inclusion – your ideas are heard, and opportunities are available to all.
Attractive employee benefits such as health insurance, lunch plan, coffee and fruit, free fitness facilities, and parking garage.
Focus on your development and well-being, with support for both professional goals and personal growth.


Ready for the next step

If Dalux sounds like a place where you could develop and contribute to the high-quality software, we would gladly accept your application. We will be having ongoing interviews.

If you have any questions, feel free to contact Simone Jena Berg Christensen, sch@dalux.com.

Who Is Dalux

Dalux is a Danish software company founded in 2005 by Ph.D. Bent Dalgaard and Torben Dalgaard. Dalux’ products are aimed at making the construction industry smarter and more effective as it is the world’s 2nd largest industry and amongst the least digitalized. Our user-friendly digital tools and Building Information Modelling-technology (also known as BIM) is used in more than 160 countries globally.

We are crazy about cool technology and have experience being first movers on new tech. Our products are based on our unique 3D BIM-technology and makes use of AR - all developed entirely by Dalux.

Application deadline:

Ongoing

Title: AI Engineer - Drive Innovation in a AI first company!
Description:
Fullstack AI Engineer | Pioneering AI and AI Agents!




What You’ll Do

We're a fast-moving team transforming financial operations and compliance using production-grade AI. This isn't a research lab, it's about building and shipping real tools that automate the hard stuff and make systems smarter, faster, and more reliable.




You will:

Build internal and external AI agents that automate workflows like invoice validation, reconciliation, KYC/AML checks, and compliance monitoring.
Use tools like GPT-4o, LangChain, n8n, Supabase, and custom Python/Node scripts to create end-to-end automations.
Translate deep domain knowledge from finance and legal into prompt-driven tools, backend logic, and APIs.
Connect your work to our core platform using REST APIs, webhooks, and third-party integrations.
Work closely with product and compliance teams to identify high-value use cases and execute fast.
Document and test your automations to ensure they scale across multiple clients and jurisdictions.
(Optionally) Build user interfaces with Retool, Lovable, or React to expose agent functionality.




Who You Are

You have 2–4 years of experience as a fullstack or backend developer.
You’ve built real AI-powered systems, agents, automations, wrappers, or workflows that do something useful.
You're confident with Python or JavaScript/TypeScript, and experienced with REST APIs and database development.
You’ve used tools like LangChain, GPT/OpenAI, Claude, Supabase, or n8n, and ideally connected them into working systems.
You enjoy solving real problems, shipping fast, and iterating based on feedback.
You understand how systems interact — tools, prompts, logic, APIs, and data flows.
Bonus: experience with finance, compliance, ERP integrations, or process-heavy industries.




Why Join Us

Work on real-world AI use cases, not demos or sandbox projects.
Join a small, highly capable, and product-driven team.
Ship and own projects that impact large, operationally complex organizations.
Help define how AI is used in an industry begging for modernization.
Enjoy a remote-first culture, fast decision-making, and real ownership over your work.




Tech Stack You'll Touch

LLMs: GPT-4o, OpenAI Functions, Claude
Frameworks: LangChain, n8n, Supabase
Languages: Python, Node.js, TypeScript
Data & APIs: REST APIs (internal and external)
Frontend (optional): Retool, Lovable, React
Cloud: Multi-cloud (flexible based on context)




Compensation

Competitive salary tailored to your experience
Remote within Denmark
Autonomy and a flat structure
Pioneer AI and AI Agents internally!
Optional access to co-working space or office (e.g. Aarhus, Copenhagen)




Ready to build real AI systems that matter? Apply now and help us automate the future of financial operations!




Please reach out to the hiring manager if you have any questions:

Luqman Mohammed-Brown - +45 88 74 11 43 / L.Mohammed-brown@tenthrevolution.com

Show more

Title: AI Engineer
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Want to join us as we take AI to the next level? Then you might be our AI Engineer.

We are a market leader in the utilization of AI, including LLMs, and have even greater visions. In the Digital Incubation and AI team, we work both as an internal AI consultant and development team, and as a strategic team, shaping our approach and architecture around generative AI. And this is where you come in.

As our AI Engineer, you will collaborate with both your colleagues on the team, and stakeholders across the company to scope, develop, and deploy leading AI solutions, as well as help design and build the underlying AI infrastructure, including working directly with AI models.

The team you will be part of - Digital Incubation and AI

As part of our Digital, Data and IT (DDI) function of +200 employees, we support the GN Group across the world, delivering business critical applications and infrastructure.

As part of our inclusive and engaging team of AI developers, digital product designers, adoption specialists, and others, you will receive a warm welcome from all members.

Your contribution is appreciated, and you will:

Your role will involve guiding the evolution of AI technologies through the selection, tweaking, and deployment of models, as well as crafting the core architecture and platforms, and developing solutions for end users.

Specifically, your work will include, but is not limited to, the following assignments


Scoping, planning, and development of AI solutions on various platforms.
Documenting existing processes as well as the developed solutions.
AI model development, including data preprocessing, feature engineering, model training and evaluation.
Participating and leading projects to scope, develop, and deploy value-driving solutions.
Further iterating solutions once they reach production in a DevOps setup.


You will be challenged with the complexity of a truly global organization and in this context, you will need to navigate across cultures, functions, and organizational levels.

To thrive in the role, we imagine that you:

We imagine that you are team-oriented and can manage your own tasks when necessary. You are result-oriented with an open mind-set for collaborating. You demonstrate accountability and are prepared to operate within a fluid work environment, having experience with Agile practices or being open to acquiring that knowledge.

Moreover, we imagine that you have:


A higher educational background within Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science or a related field of study.
Proficiency in relevant programming languages, such as Python (prioritized), Java, or C++.
Experience working with data and data libraries, such as NumPy and pandas.
Experience in designing and experimenting with algorithms and models for various use cases.
Familiarity with Azure app Service - and applicants with familiarity with Azure DevOps and experience with both open-source models and frameworks are encouraged to apply.
Fluency in written and spoken English, since it is essential you can communicate effortlessly with your colleagues, no matter where in the World they are. If you are fluent in one of the Scandinavian languages it is a benefit, but this not a perquisite for the position.


Your new position will benefit from your openness to learning and your inquisitive nature.

We encourage you to apply

Even if you don’t match all the above-mentioned skills, we will gladly receive your application if you think you have transferrable skills. We highly value a mindset, motivation, and energy, that aligns with our core values, to not only ensure success for you, but for your team and the wider GN organization as well.

We are dedicated to an inclusive recruitment process

All applicants will receive equal consideration for employment. As such, we encourage you to submit your CV without a photo to ensure an equal and fair application process.

Should you have any special requirements for the Interview please let the hiring manager know upon accepting invitation to interview.

How to apply?

Use the ‘APPLY’ link no later than 7th of September 2025. Applications are assessed on a continuous basis, so don’t wait to send yours.

On a time crunch? Feel free to only submit your up-to-date CV including a few sentences outlining your motivation for applying – quick and easy.

If you want to know more about the position, you are welcome to contact Thomas Grønfeldt Senger, head of Digital Incubation and AI, on LinkedIn or on +45 27799947.

Join us in bringing people closer

GN brings people closer through our leading intelligent hearing, audio, video, and gaming solutions. Inspired by people and driven by innovation, we deliver technology that enhance the senses of hearing and sight. We help people with hearing loss overcome real-life challenges, improve communication and collaboration for businesses and provide great experiences for audio and gaming enthusiast.

We hope you will join us on this journey and look forward to receiving your application.
Show more

Title: Research Scientist
Place: Hørsholm, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Research Scientist – Bioanalytical Team

Location: Hørsholm, Denmark

We are seeking an experienced Research Scientist to join the Bioanalytical Team at FMC’s European Innovation Centre in Hørsholm.

You will be a key member in our natural product development projects working closely together with microbiology, fermentation, formulation and field experts. You will perform chemical analysis on conventional products as well as produce, isolate, purify and characterise new and known natural products for testing as agrochemicals using advanced instruments such as HPLC, LC-QTOF, LC-MS/MS and prep flash chromatography system.

Key Responsibilities


Preparation of selected natural products. This includes arranging source material, crude material extraction and isolating, purifying and characterising the desired compounds.
Chemical analysis of known targets in samples deriving from R&D teams
Manage collaborations with internal/external partners for additional sample preparation and chemical characterisation
Support members of the team with instrument troubleshooting and development of analytical methods
Routine maintenance and qualification of laboratory instruments
General housekeeping, and contributing to safety activities


About You

You are a proactive and collaborative scientist who thrives in a dynamic environment and in a job that requires hands on lab work. You have strong communication skills and the ability to build good relationships with people around you.

You Bring


PhD and 3+ years of experience working with natural product chemistry
Experience in analysis of complex mixtures and isolation and purification of milligram amounts using LC-QTOF, Prep HPLC and flash chromatography
Familiar with techniques used for structure elucidation
Knowledge of natural product literature and technologies
Excellent communication and collaborative skills and the ability to work effectively in a multidisciplinary team environment
Confidence working in English, our primary business language


Why FMC?

At FMC, you'll join a supportive, purpose-driven team committed to innovation in sustainable agriculture. We invest in our people and encourage continuous learning and career development.

FMC Corporation is a global agricultural sciences company developing advanced solutions that combine synthetic and biological crop protection, plant health, and precision agriculture technologies.

We review applications on an ongoing basis and will close the vacancy once the right candidate is found.

Interested? We look forward to hearing from you.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist (Randers SV, DK, 8940)
Description:
14/08/2025

Group CFO

DNK-Randers, Danish Crown Vej

Data Scientist

Do you believe there’s a connection between bacon and data? Do you want to be part of a team whose mission is to turn data into delicious insights?

At Danish Crown, we believe that just as bacon is a key product in our portfolio, data is the essential ingredient that drives our innovation and success, helping us to optimize processes, predict trends, and maintain our leadership in the industry – and we’re now looking for a talented Data Scientist to join our team and help us in this journey ahead of us.

Responsibilities

As a Data Scientist at Danish Crown, you will be responsible for analyzing complex data sets to uncover valuable insights, developing predictive models, and working closely with cross-functional teams to drive data-informed decision-making. You will be involved in various projects, such as:


Commodity, livestock, and product forecasting.
Object detection and tracking in real-time video feeds from production sites.


Success starts with a team

You will become part of the Data Science team within the Data, Analytics & AI space in the Global IT department. We work on multiple initiatives for various business units, with tasks around delivering data analysis and insights, modelling of complex data sources, and research and implementation of machine learning and deep learning models for tasks such as time-series forecasting, image recognition, or natural language processing, amongst others.

We are curious about the latest developments in our space, and therefore actively encourage everyone to have an innovative mindset and propose their ideas for further incubation.

Key Responsibilities

You’ll be part of helping Danish Crown become a data-first organization. Your main tasks will include:


Providing actionable insights, identify trends and measure performance by conducting advanced statistical and other analyses.
Developing analytical solutions by creating, testing and implementing complex models and algorithms.
Implementing scalable, sustainable solutions addressing business needs in collaboration with AI/ML and Data Engineers.
Explaining the design, functioning and output of analytical models/solutions to consumers.
Staying up to date with the latest trends and advancements in data science and machine learning.


Who are we looking for?

A passionate and detail-oriented colleague with a knack for uncovering insights from data, thriving in a collaborative environment and always eager to learn and apply new technologies.

With a strong analytical mindset, you enjoy solving complex problems and your excellent communication skills allow you to effectively convey technical information to non-technical stakeholders.

Additional Qualifications


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Scientist or in a similar role.
Strong programming skills in Python. SQL is a plus.
Strong knowledge of machine learning algorithms and statistical modeling techniques.
Fluent in English. Understanding of Danish can be a plus.
Familiar with cloud platforms and version control.


Appetite For More?

If you have any questions about the position, please feel free to contact Manager, Data Science Global IT, Francesc Joan Riera at (+45) 60 90 67 72.

We review candidates continuously, so let us know why you are the right candidate for the job and send it together with your CV. We aim for a start, as soon as possible – will wait for the right person.

We are a food company owned by Danish farmers supplying high-quality food to customers and consumers worldwide. From butchers to business developers, we're more than 24,000 colleagues, all committed to lowering our carbon footprint and becoming climate-neutral by 2050 for better food and a brighter future.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist, Commercial Excellence - Denmark, Sweden, Netherlands, Finland or Germany
Description:
Location

Viby J, DK

At Arla Foods, we are committed to creating the future of dairy through innovation, sustainability, and collaboration. As a farmer-owned cooperative and one of the world’s leading dairy companies, we produce household-favourite brands while striving to make a positive impact on people and the planet.

We are now looking for a data-driven, curious, and growth-minded Data Scientist to join our Commercial Excellence Team. If you are passionate about turning complex data into actionable insights and want to make a real business impact, this is your opportunity.

How You Will Make An Impact

As a Data Scientist in the NRM Centre of Excellence organisation, you will play a key role in supporting Arla’s growth and profitability ambitions across our European markets. This is a hands-on, operational role where you will work closely with cross-functional teams to analyse commercial data, develop advanced analytics tools, and translate insights into strategic decisions.

You will be the go-to expert for understanding our data landscape - identifying opportunities, addressing challenges, and helping shape the future of data science at Arla within the commercial space. Your key responsibilities will be to


Translate business objectives into data science problems and develop solutions that drive commercial value
Design, optimise, and deploy advanced analytics models to support NRM strategies
Continuously improve existing models and develop new ones to meet evolving business needs
Visualise insights using tools like Power BI and communicate findings to stakeholders in a clear, compelling way
Conduct exploratory data analysis, test hypotheses, and uncover trends and patterns
Ensure high-quality code, documentation, and scalable, stable solutions


What Will Make You Successful

We are looking for a Data Scientist who is not only technically skilled but also driven by curiosity and a passion for creating value. You are proactive and thrive on identifying opportunities for improvement, always ready to share new ideas and perspectives on how data can be leveraged to drive the business forward. Besides this, we imagine that you bring


A University degree in a quantitative field such as statistics, econometrics, mathematics, or data science
2-5 years of hands-on experience, where you have applied advanced analytics to real-world business problems
An analytical mindset with the ability to synthesize data from multiple sources
Proficiency in Python and/or R, and SQL
Experience working with large, complex datasets (e.g., Nielsen, SAP, retailer ePOS)
Strong understanding of relational databases (e.g., Oracle, SQL Server)
Advanced Excel skills and strong data visualization capabilities (PowerBI or similar)
Preferably experience with Databricks


What do we offer?

We are committed to professional development and promoting from within. Our positive and collaborative culture will bring out the best in you. You will join a market leader who produces nutritious household-favorite brands in a way that make things better for our customers, the farmers who own us, and the whole world.

Application and contact

Please apply as soon as possible as we process applications on an ongoing basis. If you have any specific questions about the role, please reach out to Harri Härkönen, ‎Head of Commercial Digital Transformation, at +358 40 5534945.

Shape the Future of Dairy

Arla is a global leader in the dairy industry, committed to producing high-quality products while championing sustainability and innovation. We're passionate about people and our planet, striving to unleash the full potential in each of us. Our goal is to make healthy dairy nutrition and good food habits accessible to all. Join us at Arla Foods and become part of a worldwide cooperative dedicated to making a significant impact on the planet and steering the dairy industry towards a sustainable future.

We are devoted to creating a workplace where everyone feels valued and empowered to bring their authentic selves to work. Diversity and collaboration are key to our success, propelling us to new heights in the dairy industry.

Ref. 103161

Title: MLOps Engineer
Description:
🚀 We're Hiring: MLOps Engineer | Copenhagen | Hybrid Work

Flexible salary range but roughly 50,000 DKK - 75,000 DKK p/m (Some flexibility)




Are you passionate about building reliable, scalable platforms for machine learning? We’re looking for an experienced IT Platform Engineer to help shape and support a cutting-edge MLOps environment that powers real-time model deployment and scoring across critical domains, including fraud detection and online payments.




🌍 The Role

Join a collaborative squad focused on delivering a future-proof MLOps platform built on AWS and Databricks. You'll take ownership of automating model life cycles—from development to deployment—and build CI/CD workflows, infrastructure as code, and robust ML pipelines that scale with enterprise needs.




🔧 Tech You’ll Use

Cloud: AWS (extensive use), Databricks
Languages: Python, PySpark
Infra: Terraform, Docker, GitHub Actions
Tools: MLflow for model tracking/versioning, container orchestration
Bonus: Experience with Kafka or Pub/Sub streaming is a big plus!




🎯 What You’ll Be Doing

Develop and maintain automated pipelines for ML model training, validation, and inference
Build CI/CD workflows that seamlessly move models into production
Containerize ML workloads and manage infrastructure using best-in-class tools
Collaborate in an agile setup




👤 About You

You bring at least 2 years of hands-on experience in MLOps, solid cloud knowledge, strong Python and infrastructure-as-code skills, and an eye for performance and reliability. You’re a proactive problem-solver, a team player, and passionate about scaling ML in production.




💼 What’s In It for You

A human-centred, inclusive work culture
Flexible salary range but roughly 50,000 DKK - 75,000 DKK p/m (Some flexibility)
Flexible hybrid working setup
Access to development programs and professional certifications
Comprehensive health, insurance, and well-being benefits
A competitive compensation package and extra leave options




📍Location: Copenhagen

📅 Apply now and help us transform how machine learning supports real-world impact.

#MLOps #Python #AWS #Databricks #Terraform #CI/CD #MachineLearning #TechJobs #CopenhagenJobs #HiringNow #CloudEngineering

Title: 3D Vision Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
3D VISION ENGINEER

Copenhagen, Denmark




My client is a Danish AI Healthtech Seed company creating a platform for point-of-care - equipping medical staff to a better workflow and assisting patients in the best way possible harnessing the use of AI.

The team is made of PhD's from Berkeley, Caltech and DTU Copenhagen with multiple publications in the field.

Multiple customers in Denmark, as well as Switzerland, the UK and the US.




What we need is a Computer Vision professional, ideally with a relevant MSc or PhD, up to date with the latest trends and modelling. Specifically, you should be heavily knowledgeable about:




3D reconstruction and timing
ultracalibration and sensors
SMPL and fish eye
monocular depth estimation
Strong plus if you have experience with eventt-based camera




If you hold any computer vision related publication in top conferences like ICCV, ICML, CVPR or NeurIPS, and you are interested, definitely you should apply. We look forward to hear from you!




What's in for the right profile:




You get to work with the latest technologies in a truly world class team, where AI is harnessed to create products with tangible impact and value for humanity. No fuss, no nonsense.
You get to research and experiment in a team of doers who are committed and go 100% every day.
Still early stage, so you get to bring expertise from day 1 and be one of the main characters and pillars of the AI team.
Competitive salary for Danish benchmarket (said by a recruiter who works mostly the Danish tech market) plus equity plan




The team works fully onsite in Copenhagen, so we need someone either in the Copenhagen area or who is ready to relocate.




For any enquiry, DM @Marco Mannino on Linkedin or send an email to marco@addauraftw.com




In my first screening call, I will mention salary brackets, expectations, and all details on the interview process.

Title: Senior Data Scientist - Python & Azure
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At EY, we’re all in to shape your future with confidence.

We’ll help you succeed in a globally connected powerhouse of diverse teams and take your career wherever you want it to go.

Join EY and help to build a better working world.

The opportunity

Join EY’s fast-growing AI & Data team and help us build a better working world with data. We’re looking for a Senior Data Scientist who can solve complex problems with data, create scalable machine learning solutions, and guide clients through their digital transformation journeys. If you're passionate about Python, thrive in Azure environments, and want to work at the forefront of AI innovation - this is your opportunity.

Your Key Responsibilities


Design, develop, and deploy machine learning models and data-driven solutions in Azure.
Lead end-to-end data science projects, from problem framing to model implementation and monitoring.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including data engineers, cloud architects, and domain experts.
Translate business problems into analytical frameworks and actionable insights.
Present findings and recommendations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Mentor junior data scientists and contribute to EY’s internal knowledge base and best practices.


Skills And Attributes For Success


Strong proficiency in Python for data analysis, machine learning, and scripting.
Proven experience working with Microsoft Azure services (e.g., Azure Machine Learning, Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, Azure Synapse).
Solid understanding of ML concepts, statistics, and model evaluation techniques.
Experience with data wrangling, feature engineering, and large-scale data processing.
Familiarity with DevOps/MLOps in cloud environments is a strong plus.
Ability to communicate complex ideas clearly and effectively.
A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in data science or advanced analytics roles.
Hands-on project experience deploying models in production environments using Azure.
Business acumen and experience working with clients or in consulting settings.
Proficiency in Danish


Ideally, you’ll also have


Experience with other programming languages (e.g., R, SQL, Scala) or visualization tools (e.g., Power BI).
Experience in regulated industries such as healthcare, financial services, or energy.
Certifications in Azure Data Science or related cloud technologies.


What We Look For

We are seeking a dynamic and innovative individual who is passionate about continuous learning and professional growth. Flexibility and the ability to collaborate effectively in a global team are essential. We value integrity and expect our team members to uphold the highest ethical standards. Additionally, we are looking for someone who is driven to make a meaningful impact through their work.

What We Offer You

We offer a dynamic and inclusive workplace where innovation is encouraged. You will have opportunities for learning, certification, and career growth. We provide flexible working arrangements and foster global collaboration. You will have access to cutting-edge technologies and tools. Our purpose-driven culture values integrity, collaboration, and impact.

At EY, we’ll develop you with future-focused skills and equip you with world-class experiences. We’ll empower you in a flexible environment, and fuel you and your extraordinary talents in a diverse and inclusive culture of globally connected teams. Learn more.

Are you ready to shape your future with confidence? Apply today.

To help create an equitable and inclusive experience during the recruitment process, please inform us as soon as possible about any disability-related adjustments or accommodations you may need.

EY | Building a better working world

EY is building a better working world by creating new value for clients, people, society and the planet, while building trust in capital markets.

Enabled by data, AI and advanced technology, EY teams help clients shape the future with confidence and develop answers for the most pressing issues of today and tomorrow.

EY teams work across a full spectrum of services in assurance, consulting, tax, strategy and transactions. Fueled by sector insights, a globally connected, multi-disciplinary network and diverse ecosystem partners, EY teams can provide services in more than 150 countries and territories.

Title: Data Scientist til Fraud Detection & AI Solutions
Place: Hillerød, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Kan du bygge og drifte Machine Learning-løsninger i Python? Har du erfaring med modellering, monitorering og deployment? Og vil du arbejde med landets mest interessante datagrundlag? Så er du den Data Scientist, vi søger til afdelingen Fraud Detection & AI Solutions.




Vil du fremtidssikre velfærdssamfundet med teknologier som ML, NLP og Computer Vision?




I ATP udvikler vi de it-løsninger, der får to ud af tre velfærdskroner ud til danskerne, og i Fraud Detection & AI Solutions bygger vi løsninger, der forebygger fejludbetalinger og snyd med offentlige ydelser.




Vi understøtter også effektivisering af forretningens processer ved hjælp af NLP, Computer Vision og OCR. Vi har kortlagt et stort NLP-potentiale på tværs af ATP, og nu arbejder vi på at udvikle og implementere løsningerne, så vi sikrer en effektiv udbetaling af velfærdsydelserne.




Lige nu søger vi en erfaren Data Scientist med teknisk profil, som har lyst til at arbejde med avancerede løsninger og samtidig gøre en konkret forskel.




Som vores nye Data Scientist er dine opgaver at:




arbejde tæt sammen med forretningen og kolleger med forskellige profiler for at forstå behov og omsætte dem til tekniske løsninger
udvikle og optimere modeller i Python, som ofte er baseret på Machine Learning
automatisere monitorering og sikre løbende forbedring af modelperformance
arbejde med velafprøvede principper fra softwareudvikling på analyseområder for at sikre, at vores løsninger bringes sikkert fra udvikling til produktion i vores scrum-setup
deltage aktivt i at udvikle og produktionslægge vores NLP-løsninger sammen med andre tekniske specialister.




Kan og vil du skabe resultater?




Vi forestiller os, at du har et par års erfaring som softwareudvikler eller Data Scientist, og at du:




har en relevant kandidatgrad inden for matematik, statistik, fysik, computer science, ingeniørvidenskab eller lignende
har erfaring med dataanalyse og udvikling af Machine Learning-modeller
kan arbejde i Python, SQL mv. (vil være en fordel)
trives i tværfagligt samarbejde og bidrager til et team, hvor vi lærer af hinanden
er god til at finde enkle løsninger på komplekse udfordringer.




Vil du arbejde med landets mest interessante datagrundlag?




Afdelingen Fraud Detection & AI Solutions er en del af enheden Data i ATP’s it-organisation. Her arbejder vi med data til gavn for fællesskabet og den enkelte dansker. Sagt med andre ord får vi data til at arbejde for os, så vi som samfund får mest mulig værdi ud af de data, vi som Danmarks største databank har til rådighed.




Du bliver en del af en afdeling med mere end 40 dygtige kolleger. Vi er Data Scientists, Software Developers, Data Analysts og forretningsansvarlige. Du kommer især til at arbejde tæt sammen med afdelingens dygtige tekniske specialister, som arbejder med data science og softwareudvikling i full stack-løsninger.




Vi arbejder i et højt fagligt miljø, hvor vi deler viden og hjælper hinanden med at udvikle os – både teknisk og personligt.




I afdelingen har vi ansvaret for at udvikle løsninger og værktøjer, der gør offentlige myndigheder i stand til at gennemføre koordinerede kontroller med en lang række velfærdsydelser.




Som central specialenhed har vi fokus på at forebygge og identificere fejludbetalinger, så de hurtigst muligt korrigeres og undgås i fremtiden. Derudover er vi i gang med flere effektiviseringsprojekter, hvor vi bl.a. anvender NLP og OCR.




=dig? Så send os dit CV




Send os dit CV hurtigst muligt, da vi behandler henvendelser løbende. Når du sender dit CV via vores system, får du mulighed for kort at beskrive din motivation for at søge stillingen.




I ATP arbejder vi for en fair rekrutteringsproces, og derfor beder vi dig om ikke at vedhæfte billede i dit CV eller angive din alder, når du søger.




Du kan læse mere om rekrutteringsforløbet her.




Vær opmærksom på, at vi inden ansættelse indhenter straffeattest, der ikke må give anledning til bemærkninger.




Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte sektionschef Lene Blak Rasmussen på tlf. 40 12 89 21 eller mail lru@atp.dk.







Til annoncører og rekrutteringsbureauer: ATP frabeder sig uopfordrede henvendelser om annoncering, kandidater, produkter og ydelser i forbindelse med stillingsopslag og rekrutteringer. Vi beder om, at dette respekteres, og at vores ledere og medarbejdere ikke kontaktes i den henseende.

Show more
HTML:
Kan du bygge og drifte Machine Learning-løsninger i Python? Har du erfaring med modellering, monitorering og deployment? Og vil du arbejde med landets mest interessante datagrundlag? Så er du den Data Scientist, vi søger til afdelingen Fraud Detection & AI Solutions.


Vil du fremtidssikre velfærdssamfundet med teknologier som ML, NLP og Computer Vision?


I ATP udvikler vi de it-løsninger, der får to ud af tre velfærdskroner ud til danskerne, og i Fraud Detection & AI Solutions bygger vi løsninger, der forebygger fejludbetalinger og snyd med offentlige ydelser.


Vi understøtter også effektivisering af forretningens processer ved hjælp af NLP, Computer Vision og OCR. Vi har kortlagt et stort NLP-potentiale på tværs af ATP, og nu arbejder vi på at udvikle og implementere løsningerne, så vi sikrer en effektiv udbetaling af velfærdsydelserne.


Lige nu søger vi en erfaren Data Scientist med teknisk profil, som har lyst til at arbejde med avancerede løsninger og samtidig gøre en konkret forskel.


Som vores nye Data Scientist er dine opgaver at:


  • arbejde tæt sammen med forretningen og kolleger med forskellige profiler for at forstå behov og omsætte dem til tekniske løsninger
  • udvikle og optimere modeller i Python, som ofte er baseret på Machine Learning
  • automatisere monitorering og sikre løbende forbedring af modelperformance
  • arbejde med velafprøvede principper fra softwareudvikling på analyseområder for at sikre, at vores løsninger bringes sikkert fra udvikling til produktion i vores scrum-setup
  • deltage aktivt i at udvikle og produktionslægge vores NLP-løsninger sammen med andre tekniske specialister.


Kan og vil du skabe resultater?


Vi forestiller os, at du har et par års erfaring som softwareudvikler eller Data Scientist, og at du:


  • har en relevant kandidatgrad inden for matematik, statistik, fysik, computer science, ingeniørvidenskab eller lignende
  • har erfaring med dataanalyse og udvikling af Machine Learning-modeller
  • kan arbejde i Python, SQL mv. (vil være en fordel)
  • trives i tværfagligt samarbejde og bidrager til et team, hvor vi lærer af hinanden
  • er god til at finde enkle løsninger på komplekse udfordringer.


Vil du arbejde med landets mest interessante datagrundlag?

Vi arbejder i et højt fagligt miljø, hvor vi deler viden og hjælper hinanden med at udvikle os – både teknisk og personligt.

Title: Research Scientist
Place: Ølstykke, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Research Scientist with CVD experience

Are you passionate about development of novel treatments of cardiovascular disease (CVD) and have experience working with large animal models within this field? Then you have the option to join a fast-growing scientifically-driven CRO as Minerva Imaging is now offering a unique job opportunity. We are looking for an experienced Research Scientist to join our large animal pharmacology team where we are dedicated to developing the medicines of tomorrow.




The position:

As a Research Scientist focused on CVD in the large animal pharmacology team you will be responsible for conducting pre-clinical in vivo pharmacology studies. These will include advanced surgical model induction, state-of-the-art medical imaging and biomarker endpoints which are directly translatable to the clinic. Therefore, you must have a good understanding of the disease models used within CVD research and preferably have hands-on experience with these. The ability to design and interpret in vivo pharmacology data is also crucial. The ideal candidate is structured and can handle many tasks and stakeholders at a time. You must have a dedicated and persistent attitude with an aim to succeed and deliver high-quality data.




Your key responsibilities will include:

Designing and conducting large animal in vivo pharmacology studies with in the CVD area in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders
Execution and implementation of surgically induced disease models
Molecular imaging of large animals like MRI, PET and SPECT/CT
Participation in coordination tasks within the department and with other research areas of Minerva Imaging to ensure successfully executed studies
Communication with external stakeholders (customers) orally and in writing
Optimization of current methods and procedures with your passion for high-quality data
Analyzing, interpreting, and reporting study results




Qualifications:

To succeed in the position, you should have

A life science background at minimum Master level e.g., biology, veterinary science, or (molecular) biomedicine
Some years of experience with in vivo pharmacology studies in large animals
Experience working with pre-clinical CVD models
Surgical experience in large animals is an advantage
Experience with study conduction / project management
Experience with medical imaging techniques is an advantage
Flair for - and interest in - customer contact
Highly collaborative skills since all projects rely heavily on teamwork
Ability to thrive in a very dynamic environment, where plans can change quickly
Diploma in laboratory animal science equivalent to FELASA category AD




Minerva offers:

We believe in creating an agile working environment, so we have flexible working options including the option of working from home. We care about our employees’ well-being and offer health insurance and a quality conscious lunch scheme and monthly social activities.

We are an informal organization with a strong focus on open and honest communication. We value humour and a natural care for one another.




Application:

Please submit your application to us no later than September 15th 2025. The application must include a motivated cover letter and a CV addressing the listed qualifications. Applications will be evaluated continuously.




If you have questions regarding the position, please contact Philip G. J. Pedersen at php@minervaimaging.com (applications are not accepted via email).

Minerva Imaging is a scientifically driven and integrated CRO and CDMO specialized in targeted radionuclide therapies. We focus on the use of advanced animal models within oncology, cardiovascular diseases, and in vivo molecular imaging for translational research and drug development.




We engage with our sponsors to understand their scientific questions and discuss how our methods and capabilities can provide answers. Our facility located in Ølstykke, Denmark offers best–in–industry fully integrated radiopharmaceutical research, drug development, and manufacturing services.




As part of Minerva Imaging's recruitment policy we expect all candidates to provide their personal criminal record.




Minerva Imaging is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage candidates of all backgrounds and experiences to apply.

Follow us on LinkedIn for the latest news updates or visit www.minervaimaging.com for more information.

Title: Lead AI/ML Engineer
Description:
Company Overview

team.blue is the market leader in enabling digital success for small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs) across Europe, catering to over 3 million customers in 25+ languages. Our mission is to make online business success simpler, by providing our customers with all the tools and resources they need to excel online and remain ahead of the curve.

Position Overview

We are looking for a highly skilled Lead AI/ML Engineer to technically lead our AI/ML engineering team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for developing AI & ML models and GenAI solutions that power real production use cases. This role will collaborate closely with Product, and Commercial teams, and take full ownership from ideation to deployment. The environment is fast-paced and high-responsibility, with plenty of room to grow alongside a technical, mission-driven team.

Key Responsibilities:

AI & ML Model Development & Implementation


Design, develop and optimize AI models and LLMs, including training and fine-tuning for various applications
Build, train and optimize ML models, including defining preprocessing, feature engineering, validation strategies, and hyperparameter tuning
Develop AI solutions using LLMs, agentic AI frameworks, RAG pipelines, MCP servers and other related technologies



AI & ML Engineering


Build data ingestion and transformation pipelines to support model training and deployment and ensure reproducible, scalable models
Verify data quality, perform data cleaning, and oversee data acquisition processes as needed.
Develop scalable training and inference pipelines for AI-powered applications



Deployment & Integration


Deploy models to production and create APIs to integrate AI models into business operations
Build and drive adoption of emerging LLM/MLOPs technologies, integrating AI Agents, RAGs, and LLMs using MCP workflows to streamline automation, performance tuning, and large-scale data insights



Research & Innovation


Continously research and integrate the latest advancements in AI, ML and LLMs into products
Translate scientific insights into working prototypes that bridge research and production-ready implementation
Collaborate with internal and external research partners, including academic institutions, industry labs, and vendors



Technical Leadership


Provide technical leadership in AI/ML technologies, including GenAI, Machine learning, deep learning, and natural language processing (NLP).
Ensure the technical quality of AI/ML solutions, including architecture, design, implementation, and deployment.
Mentor junior team members and drive the technical direction of AI initiatives within the group



Requirements:


6+ years of experience in AI/ML engineering, Applied AI or Research engineering, with 2+ years in a lead role
Deep expertise with GenAI technologies and concepts like LLMs, RAG, Vector databases, AI agents, MCP, LoRA, QLoRA
Strong Python skills and experience with ML frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow, sklearn), with a proven track record of building and deploying ML models
Practical experience deploying and scaling AI & ML models and agentic AI applications in a production environment, including with LLM inference and serving (vLLm, LiteLLM, TensorRT-LLM)
Knowledge of LLM/MLOps, CI/CD pipelines, and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes)
Awareness of LLM-specific risk domains, including hallucinations, fairness, and data privacy
Strong problem-solving skills with excellent communication and documentation skills
Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams



Nice to have Skills:


Experience building multi-hop RAG systems with self-consistency and chain-of-thought prompting



"Come as you are"

Everyone is welcome here. Diversity & Inclusion are at our core. Far above any technical competence, we value respect, openness, and trusted collaboration. We do not tolerate intolerance.

ESG

“At team.blue, our commitment to caring for the environment and each other is at the heart of everything we do. Our latest impact report showcases our ongoing ESG efforts and ambitious sustainability goals. Interested in learning more about our dedication to making a positive impact? Check it out here.”

The most trusted digital enabler

team.blue is a leading digital enabler for companies and entrepreneurs. It serves over 3.3 million customers in Europe and has more than 3,000 experts to support them. Its goal is to shape technology and to empower businesses with innovative digital services.

Click here to read more about team.blue
