Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Job Description

Senior ML Engineer - AI Agents

Zendesk’s people have one goal in mind: to make Customer Experience better. Our products help more than 125,000 global brands (AirBnb, Uber, JetBrains, Slack, among others) make their billions of customers happy, every day.

Our team is dedicated to providing a state-of-the-art retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) platform across multiple channels; including customer service bots, email and search. In collaboration with ML scientists, we deliver high-quality AI products leveraging the latest tools and techniques, and serve them at a scale that most companies can only dream of. We’re passionate about empowering end-users to quickly find answers to their questions, and helping our customers make the most of their knowledge base.

We’re looking for a Senior ML engineer to join our team and play a key role in levelling up the RAG platform powering Zendesk!

What You’ll Be Doing


Delivering AI-powered capabilities to our customers at Zendesk scale using the latest in LLM technology
Working closely with Product Management, ML Scientists and other ML Engineers to define feature scope and implementation strategies
Mentoring junior team members, as well as pairing with more experienced colleagues to foster mutual learning
Supporting our deployed services to ensure a high level of stability and reliability
Contributing to discussions regarding technical design and best practices
Writing clean and maintainable code to meet the team’s delivery commitments
Here some of the challenges you will be working on:
How do we best expand our RAG platform to handle new use cases?
How do we optimize our system for both speed and cost-efficiency?
How do we incorporate multiple sources of context to improve the accuracy of our generated answers?
How do we make the best use of rapidly evolving LLM technologies?
And many more!

Basic Qualifications

What you bring to the role


4+ years developing machine learning systems in Python
Solid understanding of architecture and software design patterns for server-side applications
Experience with managing and deploying cloud services with a cloud provider (AWS, GCP, Azure)
Experience building scalable and stable software applications
Collaborative and growth mindset, with a commitment to ongoing learning and development
Self-managed and agile, with the ability to problem-solve independently
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal


Preferred Qualifications


Experience with using LLMs at scale
Experience in designing and implementing RAG systems
Experience with managing and deploying cloud services with AWS
Proven experience making data-driven engineering decisions; formulating hypotheses, conducting experiments, and analyzing results.


What Our Tech Stack Looks Like


Our code is largely written in Python, with some parts in Ruby
Our platform is built on AWS
Data is stored in RDS MySQL, Redis, S3, ElasticSearch, Kafka, and Athena
Services are deployed to Kubernetes using Docker, with Kafka for stream processing
Infrastructure health is monitored using Datadog and Sentry


What We Offer


Team of passionate people who love what they do!
Exciting opportunity to work with LLMs and RAG (retrieval augmented generation), rapidly evolving fields in AI
Ownership of the product features at scale, making a significant impact for millions of customers
Opportunity to learn and grow!
Possibility to specialise in areas such as security, performance, and reliability
and everything you need to be effective and maintain work-life balance
Flexible working hours
Professional development funds
Comfortable office and a remote-friendly environment


The Intelligent Heart Of Customer Experience

Zendesk software was built to bring a sense of calm to the chaotic world of customer service. Today we power billions of conversations with brands you know and love.

Zendesk believes in offering our people a fulfilling and inclusive experience. Our hybrid way of working, enables us to purposefully come together in person, at one of our many Zendesk offices around the world, to connect, collaborate and learn whilst also giving our people the flexibility to work remotely for part of the week.

Zendesk is an equal opportunity employer, and we’re proud of our ongoing efforts to foster global diversity, equity, & inclusion in the workplace. Individuals seeking employment and employees at Zendesk are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We are an AA/EEO/Veterans/Disabled employer. If you are based in the United States and would like more information about your EEO rights under the law, please click here.

Zendesk endeavors to make reasonable accommodations for applicants with disabilities and disabled veterans pursuant to applicable federal and state law. If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to submit this application, complete any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participate in the employee selection process, please send an e-mail to peopleandplaces@zendesk.com with your specific accommodation request.

Title: Full Stack Developer - newly graduated
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Fullstack Software Developer
Could you be interested in a role that involves designing and steering the implementation of a best-in-class digital training platform? Then here’s an opportunity to take on a role as feature lead!

The position
Joining as a Software Developer, you will create and design new product features that enhance user learning outcomes. You will have a great opportunity to make your mark on the product, help grow the team and influence how the team operates. In short, you can look forward to:


Designing and implementing high-quality integrations between existing Defence products and the Learning Management System (LMS)
Implementing new custom-requested functionalities or features
Implementing best practices and finding optimum solutions together with the rest of the team
Optimize our build/deployment pipeline
Design and Develop our SaaS offering in Azure to utilize the functionalities in the product and the offerings in Azure optimally
Taking an active role in the decision-making for new product features and architecture
Writing and implementing code for the new features
Troubleshooting, optimising, and solving complex problems in an existing codebase.



Joining the team
We are growing our department with a new team in Copenhagen, which you will be part of. Hence, you will join a growing Defence business. In cooperation with our committed and highly skilled group of engineers and developers, placed in Aarhus, Copenhagen and Bucharest, you will accelerate the development and implementation of our new and innovative training solution, SitaWare Aspire.

SitaWare Aspire is a digital training platform for our Defence customers. The solution is modern and intuitive, although we continuously refine it to provide our customers with the best offering. Aspire is our youngest service product and with a strong start and success in the market, more new products will come. For the product itself, our next step is to host it in Azure and offer it to customers as a Software As A Service (SaaS) solution.

Gowing a team in Copenhagen, we hope to enhance our focus on DevOps, looking into automation by extending our build and deployment pipeline and support the SaaS solution.

Your Qualifications
We are looking for a colleague who holds a relevant bachelor’s or master’s degree within software and ideally 1–2 years of experience, possibly from a student job, internship or first role after graduation. On a personal manner, we are looking for someone who will enjoy being part of a new team in Copenhagen by building a strong team spirit, both locally and across locations. Technically, we are looking for someone with a toolbox comprising:


Java/Kotlin and Spring
Build/deployment pipelines
Experience with Azure or other cloud provider platforms
Experience building and deploying services, relational databases and Keycloak



If you, furthermore, have an interest in or competencies within some of these technologies:
Angular, Typescript, and Scripting in Bash/PowerShell, it will be an advantage, but it is not a requirement. However, it is a requirement that you are comfortable communicating in English, as it is our corporate language and used daily in conversations with colleagues worldwide.

Please note that you must be able to present a clean criminal record and have lived in a NATO and/or an EU country for the past seven years as we work with security-classified projects. Read more here.

In the first period of your employment, you should expect travel activity to our HQ in Aarhus where we will make sure that you receive a great onboarding – both to Systematic but also to how we develop our software.

Never stop developing
Systematic is truly international, proudly Danish and uniquely people-centric. Together, we write intelligent and innovative code to drive progress and improve lives. We develop IT solutions that make a real difference where it matters most. This is why we never stop developing. Here, there is room to be professional and personal. It is not just a place to work but a place to belong.

Start your development here
We will be assessing applications on an ongoing basis as we wish to welcome our new colleague as soon as possible, so click Apply Now and send us your CV today. If you have any questions, you are always welcome to contact us on tel. +45 8943 2000 and ask for Christian Vase Petersen, Senior Project Manager.

Get in touch

Kathrine Schlegel Rasmussen

Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant

HTML:
Fullstack Software Developer
Could you be interested in a role that involves designing and steering the implementation of a best-in-class digital training platform? Then here’s an opportunity to take on a role as feature lead!

The position
Joining as a Software Developer, you will create and design new product features that enhance user learning outcomes. You will have a great opportunity to make your mark on the product, help grow the team and influence how the team operates. In short, you can look forward to:

  • Designing and implementing high-quality integrations between existing Defence products and the Learning Management System (LMS)
  • Implementing new custom-requested functionalities or features
  • Implementing best practices and finding optimum solutions together with the rest of the team
  • Optimize our build/deployment pipeline
  • Design and Develop our SaaS offering in Azure to utilize the functionalities in the product and the offerings in Azure optimally
  • Taking an active role in the decision-making for new product features and architecture
  • Writing and implementing code for the new features
  • Troubleshooting, optimising, and solving complex problems in an existing codebase.


Joining the team
We are growing our department with a new team in Copenhagen, which you will be part of. Hence, you will join a growing Defence business. In cooperation with our committed and highly skilled group of engineers and developers, placed in Aarhus, Copenhagen and Bucharest, you will accelerate the development and implementation of our new and innovative training solution, SitaWare Aspire.

SitaWare Aspire is a digital training platform for our Defence customers. The solution is modern and intuitive, although we continuously refine it to provide our customers with the best offering. Aspire is our youngest service product and with a strong start and success in the market, more new products will come. For the product itself, our next step is to host it in Azure and offer it to customers as a Software As A Service (SaaS) solution.

Gowing a team in Copenhagen, we hope to enhance our focus on DevOps, looking into automation by extending our build and deployment pipeline and support the SaaS solution.

Your Qualifications
We are looking for a colleague who holds a relevant bachelor’s or master’s degree within software and ideally 1–2 years of experience, possibly from a student job, internship or first role after graduation. On a personal manner, we are looking for someone who will enjoy being part of a new team in Copenhagen by building a strong team spirit, both locally and across locations. Technically, we are looking for someone with a toolbox comprising:

  • Java/Kotlin and Spring
  • Build/deployment pipelines
  • Experience with Azure or other cloud provider platforms
  • Experience building and deploying services, relational databases and Keycloak


If you, furthermore, have an interest in or competencies within some of these technologies:
Angular, Typescript, and Scripting in Bash/PowerShell, it will be an advantage, but it is not a requirement. However, it is a requirement that you are comfortable communicating in English, as it is our corporate language and used daily in conversations with colleagues worldwide.

Please note that you must be able to present a clean criminal record and have lived in a NATO and/or an EU country for the past seven years as we work with security-classified projects. Read more here.

In the first period of your employment, you should expect travel activity to our HQ in Aarhus where we will make sure that you receive a great onboarding – both to Systematic but also to how we develop our software.

Never stop developing
Systematic is truly international, proudly Danish and uniquely people-centric. Together, we write intelligent and innovative code to drive progress and improve lives. We develop IT solutions that make a real difference where it matters most. This is why we never stop developing. Here, there is room to be professional and personal. It is not just a place to work but a place to belong.

Start your development here
We will be assessing applications on an ongoing basis as we wish to welcome our new colleague as soon as possible, so click Apply Now and send us your CV today. If you have any questions, you are always welcome to contact us on tel. +45 8943 2000 and ask for Christian Vase Petersen, Senior Project Manager.

Get in touch

Kathrine Schlegel Rasmussen

Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant

Title: Computer Vision Developer
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to develop computer vision and machine learning solutions for closing the gap between plan and reality for large scale construction projects, with the goal of minimizing waste through digitalization?

Your new role

Bringing data from offices to the construction site using 3D BIM models has long been part of our core expertise here at Dalux. Now, as one of the next steps in our effort to digitalize the construction industry, we are working to bring data from the construction site back into the office using modern c omputer v ision techniques.

As a Computer Vision Developer you will develop new features to our existing products that help improve the understanding, alignment and correspondence between 3D models of the construction site and video data gathered using our vSLAM system. As part of an R&D team, you will work on discovery of new solutions through research and rapid prototyping, and translating the findings into delivery of high quality solutions to our user’s problems.

Your background

We believe you…


Have a solid software engineering foundation from a bachelor’s degree in computer science, software engineering or IT. Master’s degree with specialization in computer vision, robotics, or machine learning is a plus.
Have hands-on experience with software development using C++ and Python. It is important that you have reached solid coding standards and strive for continuous improvement. Knowledge of C# is a plus.
Have computer vision experience or trained in the area. Hands-on experience with OpenCV is a plus.
Have machine learning experience or trained in the area. Hands-on experience with PyTorch and MLFlow is a plus.
Can work both independently and as part of a team.


Most important is your problem-solving attitude, passion for software craftmanship, and the ambition to participate in the full lifecycle of our products .

Our tech...


C++
OpenGL
Python
PyTorch
MLFlow
Kubernetes


We are focused on using the right tools for the job, and as such the list of technologies may change depending on our needs and new offerings.

What To Expect As a Daluxian

In our organization the way from idea to product is short, combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.

You will become a part of a highly skilled team of passionate individuals driven by the wish to explore new and reshape existing technologies. As Dalux is a software company, we want half of the company to consist of Software Developers. All our software development happens at our head office at Vibenshuset in Copenhagen.

We offer...


Central location in Copenhagen, focus on work/life balance without any overtime, and no dress code.
An active social environment with monthly events and social clubs.
Flat communication in our organization, where the way from idea to product is short combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.
You’ll join a highly specialized, international team with room for creativity and professional growth.
Strong focus on diversity and inclusion – your ideas are heard, and opportunities are available to all.
Attractive employee benefits such as health insurance, lunch plan, coffee and fruit, free fitness facilities, and parking garage.
Focus on your development and well-being, with support for both professional goals and personal growth.


Ready for the next step

If Dalux sounds like a place where you could develop and contribute to the high-quality software, we would gladly accept your application. We will be having ongoing interviews.

If you have any questions, feel free to contact Talent Aquisition Specialist, Simone Jena Berg Christensen, sch@dalux.com.

Who Is Dalux

Dalux is a Danish software company founded in 2005 by Ph.D. Bent Dalgaard and Torben Dalgaard. Dalux’ products are aimed at making the construction industry smarter and more effective as it is the world’s 2nd largest industry and amongst the least digitalized. Our user-friendly digital tools and Building Information Modelling-technology (also known as BIM) is used in more than 160 countries globally.

We are crazy about cool technology and have experience being first movers on new tech. Our products are based on our unique 3D BIM-technology and makes use of AR - all developed entirely by Dalux.

Application deadline:

Ongoing

Title: Nyuddannet Data Scientist med Fokus på udvikling af Modeller
Place: Brøndby Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Du elsker data. Det gør vi også. Skal vi nørde sammen?

Perfekt. Så er du scrollet til det helt rigtige sted i dit feed. Vi vil gerne låne 2 min af din tid til at overbevise dig om, at du skal være vores nye Data Scientist i Danske Spil.

”Vi vælger at gå på arbejde hver dag, ikke bare fordi vi skal, men fordi vi oprigtigt kan lide hinanden og trives i hinandens selskab. Vi er fagligt ambitiøse og fokuserede, men vi har også masser af grin og et fantastisk sammenhold. Vores dygtige Data Engineers sørger for al data tilrettelæggelse, så vi i Data Science kan fokusere på de reelle data science opgaver og skabe værdi gennem vores arbejde og ekspertise.” – Trine Brandt, Leder af BI&Data Science




Velkommen til Data Science i Danske Spil

I vores Data Science afdeling arbejder vi målrettet på at udvikle og forbedre vores modeller og infrastruktur for at sikre, at vi kan levere de bedste spil- og underholdningsoplevelser til vores kunder. Data Science er et team bestående af i alt seks Data Scientists (inklusive dig) samt en Product Owner. Vi er en del af BI & Data Science afdelingen med i alt 20 kollegaer, der alle er bundet sammen af vores passion for data. Vores ambition er at levere de bedste machine learning løsninger inden for anti-hvidvask, identifikation af problematisk spilleadfærd og personaliserede brugerrejser i vores produkt- og marketing afdelinger. Vi har et unikt datasæt både i omfang og kvalitet, og vi brænder for at bruge det aktivt til ansvarlige og fornuftige forretningsbeslutninger.




Lidt om dig, dit ansvar og dine opgaver.

Vi søger en nyuddannet og samarbejdende Data Scientist, der sammen med gode kollegaer kan tage ansvar for vores udvikling af modeller i et scrum setup. Du trives med at samarbejde og er ikke bange for at dele din viden og stille spørgsmål. Kendskab til vores produkter er ikke et krav, men det vil være en fordel, da det kan hjælpe med at gøre din læringskurve en smule mindre stejl.

Din profil:

Du har en relevant uddannelse inden for data science og modellering f.eks Matematik, Statistik, Datalogi, Data Science, Machine Learning eller lignende.
Du har gode samarbejdsevner og en god portion nysgerrighed i forhold til at arbejde i scrum setup.
Du har lyst til at arbejde med machine learning i et cloud setup (Azure og/eller Databricks).
Du er stærk på prædiktive modeller og har eventuelt stiftet bekendtskab med generativ AI.
Du er en profil der ønsker at drive leverancer.
Du har indsigt eller interesse i sportsspil, casino, skrabespil, poker og/eller lotterier.

Dine opgaver:

Indgå i teamets arbejde med udvikling, implementering, drift og eventuelle bugs på vores prædiktive og generative modeller.
Indgå i tæt dialog med forretningen og tekniske specialister om anvendelsen af modeller, og sikre et effektivt feedback-loop, der understøtter løbende gentræning og remodellering af løsninger.
Arbejde iterativt og agilt med et ”Fail fast”-mindset.
Bidrage til optimering og effektivisering af vores data science processer.




Vil du være med til at underholde danskerne?

Vi læser ansøgninger igennem løbende, men deadline for at søge er den 15. august. Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte leder af Data Science Trine Brandt på tbra@danskespil.dk. Hvis du har spørgsmål til rekrutteringsprocessen, er du velkommen til at kontakte HR Business Partner, Mette Overgaard Holm på meho@danskespil.dk.




Stillingen er placeret i en afdeling, hvor fremvisning af straffeattest er påkrævet for at overholde reglerne om forebyggelse af hvidvask og terrorfinansiering. Når du indkaldes til samtale, skal straffeattesten derfor indhentes og uploades i rekrutteringssystemet inden 1. samtale.




Vi glæder os til at møde dig,

Hilsen dine nye teammedlemmer Pia, Philip, Tryggvi, Marie Louise, Johan og Trine

Vil du være med til at underholde danskerne?

Vi læser ansøgninger igennem løbende, men deadline for at søge er den 15. august. Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte leder af Data Science Trine Brandt på tbra@danskespil.dk. Hvis du har spørgsmål til rekrutteringsprocessen, er du velkommen til at kontakte HR Business Partner, Mette Overgaard Holm på meho@danskespil.dk.


Stillingen er placeret i en afdeling, hvor fremvisning af straffeattest er påkrævet for at overholde reglerne om forebyggelse af hvidvask og terrorfinansiering. Når du indkaldes til samtale, skal straffeattesten derfor indhentes og uploades i rekrutteringssystemet inden 1. samtale.


Vi glæder os til at møde dig,

Hilsen dine nye teammedlemmer Pia, Philip, Tryggvi, Marie Louise, Johan og Trine

Title: Junior Data Scientist (student) at Choreograph
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Choreograph søger en Junior Data Scientist med passion for at omsætte data til indsigter

Er du vild med økonomi, statistik og matematisk modellering? Trives du med at finde mønstre i data og omsætte dem til meningsfulde indsigter i Python – eller andre statistiske programmeringssprog? Så er det måske dig, vi leder efter. Vi søger en bachelor- eller kandidatstuderende, der ved siden af sin videregående uddannelse ønsker at være en del af regnekraften bag rådgivningen til Nordens største virksomheder.

Hvem er vi?

Choreograph er en del af WPP Media, som er Nordens største bureaugruppe. Vi arbejder med rådgivning inden for marketing, media og salg. I data science-delen af Choreograph er udgangspunktet for vores rådgivning altid forskellige former for matematisk og statistisk analyse – herunder salgsmodeller, media buying-algoritmer, geografiske eksperimenter, dashboards m.m. Vi arbejder tæt sammen i et fagligt stærkt og anerkendt team, hvor nøgleordene er innovation, selvstændighed og faglig stolthed. Læs mere om os her: Choreograph

Jobbet

Vores kunder har store datasæt, komplekse problemstillinger og sammen skal vi omsætte de analytiske resultater til konkrete anbefalinger. En del af den tekniske udfordring er, at datamængderne konstant vokser og bliver stadig mere komplekse. Du skal være med til at løse denne udfordring. Sammen med en data scientist skal du på professionel vis håndtere kundens data, levere rådgivning og præsentere anbefalinger, som optimerer kundens investeringer baseret på et solidt analytisk grundlag.

Din daglige rutine som studentermedhjælper vil hovedsageligt være at opdatere, automatisere og klargøre data til analyser, samt opsætte indledende resultater i PowerPoint og PowerBI, alt imens du opbygger solid viden om branchen og de anvendte metoder.

Faglige og personlige kvalifikationer

Du er blandt årgangens skarpeste inden for økonomi, matematisk optimering, databehandling, statistik og/eller økonometri. Efter et introduktionsforløb, hvor du bliver fortrolig med vores anvendte datakilder og systemer, vil du selvstændigt arbejde med databehandlingen og udarbejdelse af præsentationer – i takt med, at du stifter bekendtskab med branchen, vil du få muligheden for at bistå i rådgivningen til virksomhederne og derved udvikle dine færdigheder som konsulent.

Vi forestiller os, at du:


Er i gang med en uddannelse, der giver et solidt fundament inden for økonomi og statistik
Har arbejdet med Microsoft Office-pakken (særligt PowerPoint og Excel), har kendskab til programmeringssprog som Python, og enten har erfaring med - eller interesse for - at arbejde med cloud-løsninger som Google BigQuery og SQL-baserede databaser
Er grundig, trives med at arbejde selvstændigt, og er god til at overholde deadlines
Har en vis forståelse for statistisk programmering og evt. dashboardløsninger


Vi tilbyder

Et fagligt udfordrende studiejob på ca. 15-20 timer om ugen i et engageret og dynamisk team med mere end 60 dygtige kollegaer fra hele Norden. Vi er en social gruppe, der holder af at tilbringe tid sammen uden for arbejdstiden blandt andet med padel, funktionel træning, karaoke, i fredagsbaren samt ture til udlandet, hvor vi til oktober planlægger en tur til Budapest.

Vi har højt til loftet og forventer at vores medarbejdere arbejder selvstændigt og er proaktive. Det er vores klare ambition, at du efter at have færdiggjort din uddannelse har mulighed for og lyst til at blive en del af vores organisation som fastansat.

Vores kontor ligger på Holmbladsgade 133, bag Kløvermarken på Amager, i gåafstand til Lergravsparken Metro. Vi har en fremragende kantine, hvor vi også tilbyder morgenmad, samt en masse sociale arrangementer i løbet af året, attraktive personalegoder og meget mere.

Ansøgning

Hvis ovenstående passer på dig, så send din ansøgning, CV og relevante dokumenter via linket på denne side. Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte vores Talent Lead Johan Hillers på johan.hillers@WPPMedia.com

Faglige og personlige kvalifikationer

Du er blandt årgangens skarpeste inden for økonomi, matematisk optimering, databehandling, statistik og/eller økonometri. Efter et introduktionsforløb, hvor du bliver fortrolig med vores anvendte datakilder og systemer, vil du selvstændigt arbejde med databehandlingen og udarbejdelse af præsentationer – i takt med, at du stifter bekendtskab med branchen, vil du få muligheden for at bistå i rådgivningen til virksomhederne og derved udvikle dine færdigheder som konsulent.

Vi forestiller os, at du:

  • Er i gang med en uddannelse, der giver et solidt fundament inden for økonomi og statistik
  • Har arbejdet med Microsoft Office-pakken (særligt PowerPoint og Excel), har kendskab til programmeringssprog som Python, og enten har erfaring med - eller interesse for - at arbejde med cloud-løsninger som Google BigQuery og SQL-baserede databaser
  • Er grundig, trives med at arbejde selvstændigt, og er god til at overholde deadlines
  • Har en vis forståelse for statistisk programmering og evt. dashboardløsninger

Vi tilbyder

Et fagligt udfordrende studiejob på ca. 15-20 timer om ugen i et engageret og dynamisk team med mere end 60 dygtige kollegaer fra hele Norden. Vi er en social gruppe, der holder af at tilbringe tid sammen uden for arbejdstiden blandt andet med padel, funktionel træning, karaoke, i fredagsbaren samt ture til udlandet, hvor vi til oktober planlægger en tur til Budapest.

Vi har højt til loftet og forventer at vores medarbejdere arbejder selvstændigt og er proaktive. Det er vores klare ambition, at du efter at have færdiggjort din uddannelse har mulighed for og lyst til at blive en del af vores organisation som fastansat.

Vores kontor ligger på Holmbladsgade 133, bag Kløvermarken på Amager, i gåafstand til Lergravsparken Metro. Vi har en fremragende kantine, hvor vi også tilbyder morgenmad, samt en masse sociale arrangementer i løbet af året, attraktive personalegoder og meget mere.

Ansøgning

Hvis ovenstående passer på dig, så send din ansøgning, CV og relevante dokumenter via linket på denne side. Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte vores Talent Lead Johan Hillers på johan.hillers@WPPMedia.com

requisitionid:13178

Title: Data Scientist (Randers SV, DK, 8940)
Description:
14/08/2025

Group CFO

DNK-Randers, Danish Crown Vej

Data Scientist

Do you believe there’s a connection between bacon and data? Do you want to be part of a team whose mission is to turn data into delicious insights?

At Danish Crown, we believe that just as bacon is a key product in our portfolio, data is the essential ingredient that drives our innovation and success, helping us to optimize processes, predict trends, and maintain our leadership in the industry – and we’re now looking for a talented Data Scientist to join our team and help us in this journey ahead of us.

Responsibilities

As a Data Scientist at Danish Crown, you will be responsible for analyzing complex data sets to uncover valuable insights, developing predictive models, and working closely with cross-functional teams to drive data-informed decision-making. You will be involved in various projects, such as:


Commodity, livestock, and product forecasting.
Object detection and tracking in real-time video feeds from production sites.


Success starts with a team

You will become part of the Data Science team within the Data, Analytics & AI space in the Global IT department. We work on multiple initiatives for various business units, with tasks around delivering data analysis and insights, modelling of complex data sources, and research and implementation of machine learning and deep learning models for tasks such as time-series forecasting, image recognition, or natural language processing, amongst others.

We are curious about the latest developments in our space, and therefore actively encourage everyone to have an innovative mindset and propose their ideas for further incubation.

Key Responsibilities

You’ll be part of helping Danish Crown become a data-first organization. Your main tasks will include:


Providing actionable insights, identify trends and measure performance by conducting advanced statistical and other analyses.
Developing analytical solutions by creating, testing and implementing complex models and algorithms.
Implementing scalable, sustainable solutions addressing business needs in collaboration with AI/ML and Data Engineers.
Explaining the design, functioning and output of analytical models/solutions to consumers.
Staying up to date with the latest trends and advancements in data science and machine learning.


Who are we looking for?

A passionate and detail-oriented colleague with a knack for uncovering insights from data, thriving in a collaborative environment and always eager to learn and apply new technologies.

With a strong analytical mindset, you enjoy solving complex problems and your excellent communication skills allow you to effectively convey technical information to non-technical stakeholders.

Additional Qualifications


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Scientist or in a similar role.
Strong programming skills in Python. SQL is a plus.
Strong knowledge of machine learning algorithms and statistical modeling techniques.
Fluent in English. Understanding of Danish can be a plus.
Familiar with cloud platforms and version control.


Appetite For More?

If you have any questions about the position, please feel free to contact Manager, Data Science Global IT, Francesc Joan Riera at (+45) 60 90 67 72.

We review candidates continuously, so let us know why you are the right candidate for the job and send it together with your CV. We aim for a start, as soon as possible – will wait for the right person.

We are a food company owned by Danish farmers supplying high-quality food to customers and consumers worldwide. From butchers to business developers, we're more than 24,000 colleagues, all committed to lowering our carbon footprint and becoming climate-neutral by 2050 for better food and a brighter future.
Show more

Title: Freelance Ecology / Environment Science - AI Trainer
Description:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates.

About The Company

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Ecology / Environment Science, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Generate prompts that challenge AI
Define comprehensive scoring criteria to evaluate the accuracy of the AI's answers
Correct the model's responses based on your domain-specific knowledge


How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You have a Bachelor's degree plus 6 years of relevant experience in Ecology, Environmental Science, or a related field
You hold a Master's or PhD in Ecology, Environmental Science, or a related field, along with 3 years of relevant work experience.
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge


Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
Show more

Title: Freelance Software Developer (Python Engineer) - AI Trainer
Description:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

We are looking for an experienced Python developer who enjoys building tools, environments, and infrastructure for working with LLM-based agents. You'll help create sandboxes, task systems, and CI/CD pipelines to support testing and development of AI agents. You'll also work closely with researchers and domain experts, helping them set up and use these tools effectively.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Sandboxes for running and testing AI agents safely
Tools for writing tasks and test cases for agents
CI/CD pipelines to run checks and evaluate agents
Dev environments for experts creating these tasks
Repo templates and scripts to help new contributors
Interfaces for tracking task input and agent results
Example Tasks

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

You have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Software Development, Computer Science, or other related fields.
You have 5+ years of experience writing Python code

Title: Process Data Scientist
Place: Hillerød, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for a Process Data Scientist to help us translate our manufacturing and supporting processes pain points, into first class Manufacturing Intelligence Use Cases via data analytics /science. If you thrive by being a key stakeholder in establishing the site’s process data, then you just might be a great colleague to our highly skilled Process Analytics organization.

Your New Role

The Process Data Scientist is a critical role within FUJIFILM Biotechnologies Denmark (FDBD) as the business is expanding and we are introducing new technologies, programs, and customers continuously – with data excellence being one of the mission enablers. We will provide ongoing support to our new site in Holly Springs, NC, USA.

You will be a key stakeholder in establishing the site’s process data usage and analytics value chain, whilst being the owner of already validated monitoring applications, e.g., an electronic chromatogram review setup and machine learning batch performance models. We continuously strive to identify opportunities to improve internal systems and practices, as well as provide direction and development of digital/data offerings to our partners.

Your Primary Tasks Will Be


Support process investigations, root cause analysis, optimization with data support and analysis
Process Analytics systems support to manufacturing across all product modalities
Develop, validate, and deploy ETL pipelines and help build the process data ecosystem
Support process trending, continued process verification (CPV) and annual product reviews (APQR)
Support development of applications with models for process characterization and scale-up/out
Develop, validate, and deploy multivariate batch monitoring models
Support innovation and systems improvement initiatives in the Process Analytics space



The Skills & Knowledge We Hope You Possess


You have a master’s degree in in a relevant science or engineering discipline (i.e., Engineering, Bioinformatics or similar) with 2 years of industry experience or a Bachelors in the same area with 4 years of industry experience.
You have working-knowledge of SQL and a solid understanding of data science and the Python data science ecosystem (NumPy, SciPy, pandas, Scikit-learn, Jupyter Notebook).
Familiarity with SIMCA-online, TIBCO Statistica, Visual Basic and Git version control are a plus.
It would be considered an advantage if you also have GMP experience, having worked on delivering GxP applications.



We value candidates who are naturally curious, greet people with a smile, and possess a can-do attitude. You demonstrate humility and respect for those around you. As someone who is pragmatic and structured, you have a keen focus on quality and enjoy working independently. You are proactive in dynamic entrepreneurial environments. Most importantly, you possess strong communication skills and appreciate the support of a cross-functional team.

The team

The Process Analytics team is embedded in the Process Science (PS) organization and provide leadership and subject matter expertise to existing production-ready process data business processes, while also seeking to develop and introduce new Manufacturing Intelligence in clinical, PPQ and commercial processes primarily in the large-scale Cell Culture manufacturing.

We are a growing team of highly professional dedicated scientists/engineers with data management and data science expertise - but also broad experience within pharmaceutical development and manufacturing of monoclonal antibodies.

The work environment is international and informal. The role is based in our Hillerød, Denmark location, and we offer a flexible work arrangement where a defined number of working hours can be carried out in the employee’s home.

We keep a high pace and focus on a vital work life balance while having fun. We put a strong emphasis on psychological safety through trust and empowerment within our teams and hope that this is something that speaks to you as well.

Application

Has this sparked your interest, then please upload your CV and cover letter as soon as possible, as we screen candidates on a continuous basis and call in for interviews.

The Company

FUJIFILM Biotechnologies is an industry-leading Biologics Contract Development and Manufacturing Organization (CDMO) with locations in Hillerød, Denmark, Teesside, UK, RTP, North Carolina and College Station, Texas, USA. We use our skills, dedication, and ambition to enable impact for the world’s most innovative biotech and biopharma companies reimagining healthcare’s potential. We work across the entire lifecycle of our customers’ products – enabling success throughout. Every cure, vaccine, biologic, and advancement we contribute to starts with our people and our passion. We fuel one another’s passion, help accelerate progress, expand capabilities, strengthen innovation, and improve processes to improve lives.

We offer the chance to be part of a global workplace where passion, drive and commitment are met with opportunities for professional and personal development. Deeply committed to diversity and inclusion, we ensure that everyone no matter their background or gender has an opportunity to develop. We take pride in enriching our communities, caring for our environment, and cultivating a world of opportunity for future generations.

We aim to foster a collaborative, innovative and rewarding environment, where diverse perspectives and people come together united by a common purpose and shared values. We pursue our fullest potential as individual contributors and team members. We strive to be the employer of choice and offer a competitive compensation and benefit package.

FUJIFILM Biotechnologies Denmark (FDBD) is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identify or any other protected class.

To all agencies: Please, no phone calls or emails to any employee of FUJIFILM about this requisition. All resumes submitted by search firms/employment agencies to any employee at FUJIFILM via-email, the internet or in any form and/or method will be deemed the sole property of FUJIFILM, unless such search firms/employment agencies were engaged by FUJIFILM for this requisition and a valid agreement with FUJIFILM is in place. In the event a candidate who was submitted outside of the FUJIFILM agency engagement process is hired, no fee or payment of any kind will be paid.

Title: AI Solutions & Automation Internship In Bali
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
AI Solutions & Automation Intern (Technical Business Development)

Location: Bali, Indonesia (Relocation Required)

Unpaid Internship

Start Date: ASAP

The Un-Job Opening Hook: Are you a technical visionary with a business mind, eager to bridge the gap between cutting-edge AI and real-world impact? This isn't just an internship; it's an invitation to engineer the future, integrating AI solutions and automation for a $90M USD portfolio of deep tech ventures. If you're ready to build, deploy, and transform industries from paradise, your journey starts here.

The Visionary "Why": At EX Venture, we are pioneers in human-AI collaboration, leveraging AI to bring companies to the next level. You will be at the forefront of this transformation, working directly with our portfolio companies to identify opportunities for AI integration, develop custom software, and implement automation solutions that drive efficiency and innovation. This is your chance to apply your technical skills to solve complex business problems with tangible, high-impact results, supported by a significant fund dedicated to innovation.

The "Contrarian Mind" Profile: You are a technically proficient individual with a strong understanding of AI/ML concepts and a keen interest in their business applications. You possess excellent problem-solving skills, a proactive approach to identifying opportunities, and the ability to communicate complex technical ideas to non-technical stakeholders. You are adaptable, eager to learn, and thrive in a fast-paced, project-driven environment. Experience with programming (Python preferred), data analysis, or AI/ML frameworks is highly valued.

The "Real-World Impact" Promise: Your technical expertise will directly accelerate the growth and efficiency of groundbreaking companies. You will be instrumental in:


AI Solution Design & Integration: Collaborating with business teams to identify pain points and design AI-powered solutions, then integrating them into existing workflows.
Custom Software Development: Developing bespoke AI software tools and scripts to automate processes and enhance operational capabilities.
Automation Implementation: Implementing automation strategies across various business functions to improve efficiency and reduce manual effort.
Technical Consulting: Providing technical insights and support to clients and internal teams on AI capabilities and best practices.
Project Support: Assisting in the technical aspects of project management, ensuring the successful deployment and adoption of AI solutions.


The "Paradise & Purpose" Lifestyle: Imagine your morning commute being a walk to the beach, your lunch break a paddle session, and your evenings filled with inspiring conversations under the Balinese stars. Our campus in Bali offers a unique blend of professional intensity and unparalleled personal well-being. You'll relocate to and live

within a vibrant international community, accelerating your growth through cultural immersion. Integrate work and life to fuel creativity and peak performance.

The "Meritocratic Ascent" Pathway: Your technical ingenuity and problem-solving capabilities will define your trajectory. Exceptional performance in this role can lead to accelerated growth, specialized technical leadership positions, and potential full-time roles within our portfolio companies, all while living and working in an environment that fosters peak performance.

The "AI-First Immersion": You will be at the forefront of AI innovation, not just learning about it, but actively building and deploying AI solutions for real-world problems. Our curriculum is rebuilt weekly with the newest AI agents, ensuring you are always working with cutting-edge tools and methodologies.

Call to Action: If you're ready to engineer the future with AI, embrace a global adventure, and build an extraordinary career from paradise, apply now. This is your moment to join the revolution. We are specifically looking for talent ready to make the move and thrive in our unique ecosystem. Your journey starts here.
Show more

Start Date: ASAP

The Un-Job Opening Hook: Are you a technical visionary with a business mind, eager to bridge the gap between cutting-edge AI and real-world impact? This isn't just an internship; it's an invitation to engineer the future, integrating AI solutions and automation for a $90M USD portfolio of deep tech ventures. If you're ready to build, deploy, and transform industries from paradise, your journey starts here.

The Visionary "Why": At EX Venture, we are pioneers in human-AI collaboration, leveraging AI to bring companies to the next level. You will be at the forefront of this transformation, working directly with our portfolio companies to identify opportunities for AI integration, develop custom software, and implement automation solutions that drive efficiency and innovation. This is your chance to apply your technical skills to solve complex business problems with tangible, high-impact results, supported by a significant fund dedicated to innovation.

The "Contrarian Mind" Profile: You are a technically proficient individual with a strong understanding of AI/ML concepts and a keen interest in their business applications. You possess excellent problem-solving skills, a proactive approach to identifying opportunities, and the ability to communicate complex technical ideas to non-technical stakeholders. You are adaptable, eager to learn, and thrive in a fast-paced, project-driven environment. Experience with programming (Python preferred), data analysis, or AI/ML frameworks is highly valued.

The "Real-World Impact" Promise: Your technical expertise will directly accelerate the growth and efficiency of groundbreaking companies. You will be instrumental in:

  • AI Solution Design & Integration: Collaborating with business teams to identify pain points and design AI-powered solutions, then integrating them into existing workflows.
  • Custom Software Development: Developing bespoke AI software tools and scripts to automate processes and enhance operational capabilities.
  • Automation Implementation: Implementing automation strategies across various business functions to improve efficiency and reduce manual effort.
  • Technical Consulting: Providing technical insights and support to clients and internal teams on AI capabilities and best practices.
  • Project Support: Assisting in the technical aspects of project management, ensuring the successful deployment and adoption of AI solutions.

The "Paradise & Purpose" Lifestyle: Imagine your morning commute being a walk to the beach, your lunch break a paddle session, and your evenings filled with inspiring conversations under the Balinese stars. Our campus in Bali offers a unique blend of professional intensity and unparalleled personal well-being. You'll relocate to and live

within a vibrant international community, accelerating your growth through cultural immersion. Integrate work and life to fuel creativity and peak performance.

The "Meritocratic Ascent" Pathway: Your technical ingenuity and problem-solving capabilities will define your trajectory. Exceptional performance in this role can lead to accelerated growth, specialized technical leadership positions, and potential full-time roles within our portfolio companies, all while living and working in an environment that fosters peak performance.

The "AI-First Immersion": You will be at the forefront of AI innovation, not just learning about it, but actively building and deploying AI solutions for real-world problems. Our curriculum is rebuilt weekly with the newest AI agents, ensuring you are always working with cutting-edge tools and methodologies.

Call to Action: If you're ready to engineer the future with AI, embrace a global adventure, and build an extraordinary career from paradise, apply now. This is your moment to join the revolution. We are specifically looking for talent ready to make the move and thrive in our unique ecosystem. Your journey starts here.

Title: Unsolicited job application
Place: Sønderborg Municipality, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Saab, we offer career prospects. We are well aware that the choice is therefore sometimes not easy.

But you know best what you are looking for and how you imagine your dream job to be.

Thus, before you use the opportunity to send us an unsolicited application, we kindly ask you to take a look at our job portal. The available filter options in our job list will help you to find the position you are looking for.

About Us

At Saab, we're always on the lookout for passionate, talented individuals who are eager to make a difference.

Why Submit an Unsolicited Application?

We understand that talent doesn't always fit into predefined roles or job descriptions. By submitting an unsolicited application, you have the opportunity to showcase your unique skills and experiences that could bring new perspectives and value to our team. Whether you're an experienced professional or a recent graduate, we want to hear from you!

How To Apply

Prepare Your Application:

Cover Letter: Introduce yourself and explain why you’re interested in joining our team.

Resume/CV: Provide a detailed overview of your work experience, education, and skills.

What To Expect

Once we receive your application, our HR team will review your materials and consider how your skills and experiences could fit within our organization. If there's a potential match, we'll reach out to you for further discussions. While we can’t guarantee immediate openings, we value every application and keep them on file for future opportunities.
Show more

Title: AI Engineer
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Want to join us as we take AI to the next level? Then you might be our AI Engineer.

We are a market leader in the utilization of AI, including LLMs, and have even greater visions. In the Digital Incubation and AI team, we work both as an internal AI consultant and development team, and as a strategic team, shaping our approach and architecture around generative AI. And this is where you come in.

As our AI Engineer, you will collaborate with both your colleagues on the team, and stakeholders across the company to scope, develop, and deploy leading AI solutions, as well as help design and build the underlying AI infrastructure, including working directly with AI models.

The team you will be part of - Digital Incubation and AI

As part of our Digital, Data and IT (DDI) function of +200 employees, we support the GN Group across the world, delivering business critical applications and infrastructure.

As part of our inclusive and engaging team of AI developers, digital product designers, adoption specialists, and others, you will receive a warm welcome from all members.

Your contribution is appreciated, and you will:

Your role will involve guiding the evolution of AI technologies through the selection, tweaking, and deployment of models, as well as crafting the core architecture and platforms, and developing solutions for end users.

Specifically, your work will include, but is not limited to, the following assignments


Scoping, planning, and development of AI solutions on various platforms.
Documenting existing processes as well as the developed solutions.
AI model development, including data preprocessing, feature engineering, model training and evaluation.
Participating and leading projects to scope, develop, and deploy value-driving solutions.
Further iterating solutions once they reach production in a DevOps setup.


You will be challenged with the complexity of a truly global organization and in this context, you will need to navigate across cultures, functions, and organizational levels.

To thrive in the role, we imagine that you:

We imagine that you are team-oriented and can manage your own tasks when necessary. You are result-oriented with an open mind-set for collaborating. You demonstrate accountability and are prepared to operate within a fluid work environment, having experience with Agile practices or being open to acquiring that knowledge.

Moreover, we imagine that you have:


A higher educational background within Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science or a related field of study.
Proficiency in relevant programming languages, such as Python (prioritized), Java, or C++.
Experience working with data and data libraries, such as NumPy and pandas.
Experience in designing and experimenting with algorithms and models for various use cases.
Familiarity with Azure app Service - and applicants with familiarity with Azure DevOps and experience with both open-source models and frameworks are encouraged to apply.
Fluency in written and spoken English, since it is essential you can communicate effortlessly with your colleagues, no matter where in the World they are. If you are fluent in one of the Scandinavian languages it is a benefit, but this not a perquisite for the position.


Your new position will benefit from your openness to learning and your inquisitive nature.

We encourage you to apply

Even if you don’t match all the above-mentioned skills, we will gladly receive your application if you think you have transferrable skills. We highly value a mindset, motivation, and energy, that aligns with our core values, to not only ensure success for you, but for your team and the wider GN organization as well.

We are dedicated to an inclusive recruitment process

All applicants will receive equal consideration for employment. As such, we encourage you to submit your CV without a photo to ensure an equal and fair application process.

Should you have any special requirements for the Interview please let the hiring manager know upon accepting invitation to interview.

How to apply?

Use the ‘APPLY’ link no later than 7th of September 2025. Applications are assessed on a continuous basis, so don’t wait to send yours.

On a time crunch? Feel free to only submit your up-to-date CV including a few sentences outlining your motivation for applying – quick and easy.

If you want to know more about the position, you are welcome to contact Thomas Grønfeldt Senger, head of Digital Incubation and AI, on LinkedIn or on +45 27799947.

Join us in bringing people closer

GN brings people closer through our leading intelligent hearing, audio, video, and gaming solutions. Inspired by people and driven by innovation, we deliver technology that enhance the senses of hearing and sight. We help people with hearing loss overcome real-life challenges, improve communication and collaboration for businesses and provide great experiences for audio and gaming enthusiast.

We hope you will join us on this journey and look forward to receiving your application.
Show more

We hope you will join us on this journey and look forward to receiving your application.

Title: Freelance Software Developer (Python) - Quality Assurance (AI Trainer)
Description:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Coding, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Crafting and answering questions related to computer science in order to help train AI models to meet project-specific guidelines.
Evaluating and ranking code generated by AI models
Ensuring clarity, consistency, and factual accuracy.
Providing feedback to writers and working with QA Specialists to uphold quality


How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You are currently enrolled in or completed a Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science or a related field
You have at least 3 years of professional experience with Python
Experience with Cloud sourcing platform is a plus
Code review experience is a must
Experience with AI projects is a plus
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge


Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
Show more

Title: Er du til sport, gaming og gode grin?
Place: Rudersdal Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
En 13-årig dreng i Vedbæk søger en fast makker, der har lyst til at bruge tid på alt det, han elsker – og som kan give en hjælpende hånd, når det er nødvendigt.

Om opgaven

Han er vild med PlayStation, sport og YouTube – og klar på både hygge og sjov. Han bruger kørestol og har brug for støtte til at komme rundt og i gang med aktiviteterne. Talen er begrænset, men kommunikationen fejler ikke noget – med lidt tålmodighed og de rette redskaber finder I hurtigt jeres egen måde at snakke sammen på.

Du bliver en vigtig del af hverdagen og skal både være medskaber af gode oplevelser og støtte op om det praktiske – som fx personlig pleje og ture ud af huset. Og bare rolig: du skal ikke være sportsstjerne – bare du er nysgerrig og har lyst til at være med.

Hvem er du?

Du er typen, der møder andre med et smil og tager tingene, som de kommer. Du har erfaring med personlig pleje og er tryg i rollen som den voksne – også når der opstår uforudsete situationer. Det er en bonus, hvis du har kørekort, så I nemt kan komme på tur sammen.

Uddannelse er ikke afgørende – du kan være pædagog, SOSU eller ufaglært med det rette hjerte og den rigtige tilgang.

Arbejdstid

Stillingen er på 10–25 timer om ugen.

Timerne Kan Placeres

– Hverdage mellem kl. 15.00 og 19.30

– Weekender mellem kl. 11.00 og 18.00

Der er god fleksibilitet – så I kan finde en rytme, der fungerer for jer begge.

Vi tilbyder

Du bliver en del af en familieejet virksomhed med en masse engagerede medarbejdere. Du har en fast rådgiver, som du altid kan få sparring hos. Udenfor kontorets åbningstid er der altid en bemandet vagttelefon, så du er aldrig alene. Løn og pension i henhold til Landsoverenskomst for handicaphjælp i borgers eget hjem (minus BPA) indgået mellem FOA og Dansk Erhverv. Du er dækket af DUOS’ ansvars- og arbejdsskadeforsikring og sundhedsforsikring er en del af din pensionsordning. Du modtager relevant introduktion og løbende opkvalificering - og så kan du slet ikke undgå at udvikle dig både personligt og fagligt, når du arbejder med mennesker hos os i DUOS.

Vil du være vores nye kollega?

Så send en ansøgning via linket. Du skal have en profil på mit.duos.dk og være logget ind for at søge. Vi holder samtaler løbende, send derfor gerne din ansøgning med det samme. Tiltrædelse snarest muligt. Har du yderligere spørgsmål, er du velkommen til at kontakte rekrutteringskonsulent Anika Christiansen på 3634 4990. Du kan altid finde svar på generelle spørgsmål her: FAQ

Vi er mennesker, der hjælper mennesker

I DUOS hjælper vi mennesker i hverdagen, støtter dem i svære situationer og bidrager til deres trivsel og livskvalitet. Som en af Danmarks største og ældste velfærdsleverandører stræber vi efter at være til stede der, hvor behovet er. Vi kender betydningen af den rette empati og den rette faglige viden, og vi ved, at det er afgørende at sikre det rette match mellem medarbejder og borger, hvis vores ydelser skal have værdi.

Kom og vær med på DUOS-holdet. Og gør en vigtig forskel for et andet menneske.

Læs mere om DUOS på www.duos.dk
Show more
